original: de ma yin pa gzhan 'bras bu gang gi phyir zhugs kyang rung ste /🔽de dag thos par bya ba'i phyir 'jug par bya'o snyam du sems gzhan du bsgom pa'am /
analyzed: de ma yin pa gzhan 'bras bu gang gi phyir zhugs kyang rung ste / de dag thos par bya ba'i phyir 'jug par bya'o snyam du sems gzhan du bsgom pa'am /
translated: Or else, one cultivates the thought: “I will enter into those results that are not mine, in order to hear about them.”🔽Or else, one cultivates the thought: “I will enter into those results in order to attain them.”

original: 'bras bu de dag gis ji ltar thob par bya'o snyam du sems bzhin du bsgom pha ni re ba yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu de dag gis ji ltar thob par bya'o snyam du sems bzhin du bsgom pha ni re ba yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “keeping hope in mind.”

original: de yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ram zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin rnams yongs su rdzogs shing mthar phyin par bya ba'i phyir zhugs kyang rung zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ram zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin rnams yongs su rdzogs shing mthar phyin par bya ba'i phyir zhugs kyang rung zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “In order to perfect them” means: one enters into the meditative concentrations in order to perfect them, in order to bring them to completion.

original: dge sbyong gi 'bras bu 'thob par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa dge sbyong gi 'bras bu thob par bya ba'i phyir zhugs kyang rung zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi 'bras bu 'thob par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa dge sbyong gi 'bras bu thob par bya ba'i phyir zhugs kyang rung zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “In order to attain the fruits of asceticism” means: one enters into the meditative concentrations in order to attain the fruits of asceticism such as stream-enterer.

original: sa la 'jug pa'i phyir ram zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis sa bcu rim gyis thob par bya ba'i phyir zhugs kyang rung zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sa la 'jug pa'i phyir ram zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis sa bcu rim gyis thob par bya ba'i phyir zhugs kyang rung zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: For the sake of entering the stages means that even though one has entered for the sake of attaining the ten stages by oneself, the meaning is it is all right.

original: khyad par thob pa'i phyir ram zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: khyad par thob pa'i phyir ram zhes bya ba la /
translated: For the sake of attaining special qualities means

original: yang na bdag gis mngon par shes pa lnga la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par thob par bya ba'i phyir zhugs kyang rung zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang na bdag gis mngon par shes pa lnga la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par thob par bya ba'i phyir zhugs kyang rung zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: that even though one has entered for the sake of attaining special qualities such as the five superknowledges, the meaning is it is all right.

original: gang gi phyir 'jug pa na zhes bya ba'i don ni gzhan yang de la ma gtogs pa'i yon tan stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan gang gi phyir zhugs kyang rung /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'jug pa na zhes bya ba'i don ni gzhan yang de la ma gtogs pa'i yon tan stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan gang gi phyir zhugs kyang rung /
translated: The meaning of when one enters is that even though one has entered for the sake of other qualities such as the powers, the confidences, and so on,

original: de dag thob par bya'o snyam du sems shing bsgom pa ni re ba'i sems zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag thob par bya'o snyam du sems shing bsgom pa ni re ba'i sems zhes bya'o //
translated: thinking I must attain those, the cultivation is called the hopeful mind.

original: sems nyid dmigs par snang ba ste /
analyzed: sems nyid dmigs par snang ba ste /
translated: The mind itself appears as the objective support.

original: sems @265b las gzhan dmigs pa med de //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems @265b las gzhan dmigs pa med de //🔽zhes bya ba la /
translated: There is no objective support other than the mind.

original: gong du sems drug bshad pa'i skabs su sems drug gi dmigs pa'i yul bshad pa de dag kyang /
analyzed: gong du sems drug bshad pa'i skabs su sems drug gi dmigs pa'i yul bshad pa de dag kyang /
translated: In the above explanation of the six states of consciousness, the objects of observation of the six states of consciousness were explained.🔽

original: sems nyid dmigs pa'i yul rnam pa drug snang ba lta bur zad kyi /
analyzed: sems nyid dmigs pa'i yul rnam pa drug snang ba lta bur zad kyi /
translated: The above explanation of the six objects of observation of the six consciousnesses is exhausted in the appearance of the six aspects of the object of observation of mind-itself.

original: sems las ma gtogs par sems kyi dmigs par bya ba'i yul sems las logs shig na gzhan med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems las ma gtogs par sems kyi dmigs par bya ba'i yul sems las logs shig na gzhan med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that apart from mind there is no other object of observation of mind.

original: sems tsam du shes kyang rung mi shes kyang rung zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sems tsam du shes kyang rung mi shes kyang rung zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Whether one knows that as only mind or not, and so on.

original: sems rnam pa drug po de dag gi yul rnams sems tsam du zad pa'i bsam pa'i shes rab kyis khong du chud de /🔽sems tsam du shes kyang sems drug po la bsgom pa na /
analyzed: sems rnam pa drug po de dag gi yul rnams sems tsam du zad pa'i bsam pa'i shes rab kyis khong du chud de / sems tsam du shes kyang sems drug po la bsgom pa na /
translated: The wisdom that is the thought that the objects of those six consciousnesses are exhausted in being only mind comprehends that.

original: drug po de dag sems tsam du mi shes kyang rung zhe'am /
analyzed: drug po de dag sems tsam du mi shes kyang rung zhe'am /
translated: Whether one knows the six consciousnesses as only mind or not, when meditating on the six consciousnesses,🔽it is sufficient that one does not know those six as only mind.

original: bsam pa'i shes rab kyis sems tsam du shes pa med kyi /
analyzed: bsam pa'i shes rab kyis sems tsam du shes pa med kyi /
translated: Or, the wisdom that is the thought does not know those as only mind.

original: thos pa'i shes rab kyis 'di ltar sems tsam du zad kyi sems las logs shig na yul gzhan med do zhes kyang rung ste /
analyzed: thos pa'i shes rab kyis 'di ltar sems tsam du zad kyi sems las logs shig na yul gzhan med do zhes kyang rung ste /
translated: By the wisdom of listening, one should think: “It is just mind only. There is no external object apart from mind.”

original: don du na sems nyid sems rnam pa drug gi dmigs pa lta bur snang ba zad de /
analyzed: don du na sems nyid sems rnam pa drug gi dmigs pa lta bur snang ba zad de /
translated: In fact, mind itself appears as the object of the six consciousnesses.

original: sems las gzhan ma yin pas sems drug po yang sems tsam par rnam par bzhag go //
analyzed: sems las gzhan ma yin pas sems drug po yang sems tsam par rnam par bzhag go //
translated: Since there is nothing other than mind, the six consciousnesses are also posited as mind only.

original: de ltar rnal 'byor pa sems drug la bsgom pa bsgom pa des /
analyzed: de ltar rnal 'byor pa sems drug la bsgom pa bsgom pa des /
translated: Thus, the yogi/nī who meditates on the six consciousnesses

original: yid la byed pa bcu gcig bsgom zhing yid la bya ste /
analyzed: yid la byed pa bcu gcig bsgom zhing yid la bya ste /
translated: should meditate on and attend to eleven mental engagements.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,🔽it is said:

original: tshol dang so sor rtog pa dang // yid kyi rtog pa rgyun du bya //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: tshol dang so sor rtog pa dang // yid kyi rtog pa rgyun du bya // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Seek, discriminate, and continuously engage in mental conception.

original: de la yid la byed pa bcu gcig ni rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de la yid la byed pa bcu gcig ni rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The eleven mental engagements are those with conception and those without conception, and so on.

original: yid la byed pa bcu gcig kyang tshigs su bcad pa bzhis bstan to //
analyzed: yid la byed pa bcu gcig kyang tshigs su bcad pa bzhis bstan to //
translated: The eleven mental engagements are presented in four verses.

original: de la tshol ba yid kyis rtog pa rgyun du bya ba dang / so sor rtog pa yid kyis rtog pa rgyun du bya'o zhes tshig de lta bu'o //🔽de la tshol ba yid kyis rtog pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la tshol ba yid kyis rtog pa rgyun du bya ba dang / so sor rtog pa yid kyis rtog pa rgyun du bya'o zhes tshig de lta bu'o // de la tshol ba yid kyis rtog pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase one should always apply the conceptual thought of investigation refers to the conceptual thought of investigation, and the phrase one should always apply the conceptual thought of discernment refers to the conceptual thought of discernment.🔽The conceptual thought of investigation is explained as follows:

original: rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i yid la byed pa bstan te /
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i yid la byed pa bstan te /
translated: conceptual thought and investigation refer to the mental attention that is associated with conceptual thought and investigation.

original: de'ang mi lcogs pa med pa dang / bsam gtan dang po'o //
analyzed: de'ang mi lcogs pa med pa dang / bsam gtan dang po'o //
translated: This is the stage of no analysis and the first meditative concentration.

original: de la tshol ba la rtog par ci mngon zhe na /
analyzed: de la tshol ba la rtog par ci mngon zhe na /
translated: How do we know that the conceptual thought of investigation refers to investigation?

original: gtsug lag las rtog pa'i mtshan nyid bshad pa'i skabs su rtog pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: gtsug lag las rtog pa'i mtshan nyid bshad pa'i skabs su rtog pa gang zhe na /
translated: In the Abhidharma, the chapter on the characteristics of conceptual thought states: What is conceptual thought?

original: tshol ba yid kyi 'jog pa'o zhes bstan pas na tshol ba la rtog pa zhes bya bar mngon no //
analyzed: tshol ba yid kyi 'jog pa'o zhes bstan pas na tshol ba la rtog pa zhes bya bar mngon no //
translated: It is the placement of the mind in investigation. Thus, the conceptual thought of investigation refers to investigation.

original: so sor rtog pa yid kyis rtog pa zhes bya bas mi rtog cing dpyod pa tsam gyis yid la byed pa bstan te /
analyzed: so sor rtog pa yid kyis rtog pa zhes bya bas mi rtog cing dpyod pa tsam gyis yid la byed pa bstan te /
translated: The phrase one should always apply the conceptual thought of discernment refers to the mental attention that is free of conceptual thought but is associated with investigation alone.

original: de yang bar gyi bsam gtan dang bsam gtan gnyis pa la bya'o //
analyzed: de yang bar gyi bsam gtan dang bsam gtan gnyis pa la bya'o //
translated: This is the intermediate meditative concentration and the second meditative concentration.

original: @266a * // so sor rtog pa la dpyod pa zhes bya bar ci mngon zhe na /
analyzed: @266a * // so sor rtog pa la dpyod pa zhes bya bar ci mngon zhe na /
translated: What is the evidence that discernment is called investigation?

original: gtsug lag las dpyod pa'i mtshan nyid bshad pa'i skabs su dpyod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: gtsug lag las dpyod pa'i mtshan nyid bshad pa'i skabs su dpyod pa gang zhe na /
translated: In the Abhidharma, in the section explaining the characteristics of investigation, it says, “What is investigation?🔽It is discernment that is placed by the mind.”

original: so sor rtog pa yid kyis 'jog pa'o zhes bshad pa'i phyir dpyod pa la so sor rtog pa zhes bya par mngon no //
analyzed: so sor rtog pa yid kyis 'jog pa'o zhes bshad pa'i phyir dpyod pa la so sor rtog pa zhes bya par mngon no //
translated: Thus it is clear that investigation is called discernment.

original: rnam par mi rtog ro gcig pa'i //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog ro gcig pa'i //
translated: The attention of non-discursive one taste

original: yid la byed pa brtag par bya'o //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yid la byed pa brtag par bya'o // zhes bya ba la /
translated: should be understood.

original: rnam par mi rtog ro gcig pa zhes bya bas mi rtog mi dpyod pa'i yid la byed pa bstan te /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog ro gcig pa zhes bya bas mi rtog mi dpyod pa'i yid la byed pa bstan te /
translated: Here, non-discursive one taste indicates non-discursive and non-analytical attention.

original: de'ang bsam gtan gsum pa dang bzhi pa ste /🔽de'i tshe rtog dpyod dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid du nang gcig par bsgom pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'ang bsam gtan gsum pa dang bzhi pa ste / de'i tshe rtog dpyod dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid du nang gcig par bsgom pa'i phyir te /
translated: That is the third and fourth absorptions.🔽At that time, it is cultivated as having the characteristic of being free from discursive thought and investigation,

original: rtog dpyod dang bral ba rnam par mi rtog pa'i ro gcig pa de la rtag tu yid la byed pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rtog dpyod dang bral ba rnam par mi rtog pa'i ro gcig pa de la rtag tu yid la byed pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: because it is always the attention of non-discursive and non-analytical one taste.

original: zhi gnas lam du shes bya ste //
analyzed: zhi gnas lam du shes bya ste //
translated: One should know the path of serenity

original: des na chos dang ming bsdus pa //
analyzed: des na chos dang ming bsdus pa //
translated: By the inclusion of the Dharma and the name.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: ming gang chos rnams kyi don dang tshig bsdus pa la ming bsdus zhes bya ste /🔽dper na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i ming gis /
analyzed: ming gang chos rnams kyi don dang tshig bsdus pa la ming bsdus zhes bya ste / dper na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i ming gis /
translated: The name is the inclusion of the meaning and the expression of the Dharma.

original: shes rab kyi kyi  pha rol tu phyin pa'i don dang tshig mang po bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi kyi  pha rol tu phyin pa'i don dang tshig mang po bsdus pa'o //
translated: For example, the name “Perfection of Wisdom” includes the meaning and the expression of the Perfection of Wisdom.

original: dang gi sgras ni rjes su 'gro ba'i sems kyis mdo sde'i tshig so sor shes par bya ba'i tshig la bsnyegs te /
analyzed: dang gi sgras ni rjes su 'gro ba'i sems kyis mdo sde'i tshig so sor shes par bya ba'i tshig la bsnyegs te /
translated: The word “and” indicates that the mind which follows the words of the sutra, and which is directed to the words,

original: don du mdo sde'i ming dang tshig la dmigs par byed pa ni zhi gnas kyi lam du shes par bya ste /
analyzed: don du mdo sde'i ming dang tshig la dmigs par byed pa ni zhi gnas kyi lam du shes par bya ste /
translated: should be known as the path of serenity, because it is directed to the name and the expression of the sutra.

original: 'dis ni zhi gnas yid la byed pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni zhi gnas yid la byed pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the attention to serenity.

original: de'i don dag rnam brtags phyir //
analyzed: de'i don dag rnam brtags phyir //
translated: Because of the examination of their meaning,

original: lhag mthong du ni shes par bya //
analyzed: lhag mthong du ni shes par bya //
translated: One should know it as insight.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: de'i don zhes bya ba ni mdo sde rnams kyi ming dang tshig rnams kyi don te /🔽de yang bgrang ba dang gzhal ba dang dpyad pa dang rtog pa ste chos de dag gi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la rtog cing /
analyzed: de'i don zhes bya ba ni mdo sde rnams kyi ming dang tshig rnams kyi don te / de yang bgrang ba dang gzhal ba dang dpyad pa dang rtog pa ste chos de dag gi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la rtog cing /
translated: The meaning of that is the meaning of the names and phrases of the sutras.

original: phyin ci ma log par shes par byed pa ni lhag mthong gi lam du shes par bya ste /
analyzed: phyin ci ma log par shes par byed pa ni lhag mthong gi lam du shes par bya ste /
translated: That is to say, one should understand the path of insight to be the investigation of the general and particular characteristics of those dharmas, by way of counting, measuring, examining, and discerning them.

original: 'dis ni lhag mthong yid la byed pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni lhag mthong yid la byed pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the attention to insight.

original: de dag bsdus pa'i lam de ni //🔽zung du 'brel bar shes par bya //
analyzed: de dag bsdus pa'i lam de ni // zung du 'brel bar shes par bya //
translated: That path which includes those

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: should be understood as the union.

original: zhig nas dang lhag mthong zung du ma 'brel pa'i dus na ni so sor dmigs te /
analyzed: zhig nas dang lhag mthong zung du ma 'brel pa'i dus na ni so sor dmigs te /
translated: When serenity and insight are not united, one focuses on each separately.

original: zhi gnas kyis ni ming dang tshig la dmigs /
analyzed: zhi gnas kyis ni ming dang tshig la dmigs /
translated: Serenity focuses on the name and phrase,

original: lhag mthong gis ni don la dmigs par byed do //
analyzed: lhag mthong gis ni don la dmigs par byed do //
translated: while insight focuses on the meaning.

original: nam zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel na ni ming dang don la so sor mi dmigs kyi /
analyzed: nam zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel na ni ming dang don la so sor mi dmigs kyi /
translated: But when serenity and insight are united, one does not focus separately on the name and the meaning.

original: de gnyis gcig tu bsdus nas zhi gnas lhag mthong mgo mnyam du 'brel te dmigs par byed pa'i lam de ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung ngu 'brel ba'i lam du shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de gnyis gcig tu bsdus nas zhi gnas lhag mthong mgo mnyam du 'brel te dmigs par byed pa'i lam de ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung ngu 'brel ba'i lam du shes par bya ste /
translated: The path that combines those two, and that is directed to the object of meditation in which serenity and insight are equally united, should be understood as the path of serenity and insight in union.

original: 'dis ni zung @266b du 'brel pa yid la byed pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni zung @266b du 'brel pa yid la byed pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the attention to their union.

original: zhum pa'i sems ni rab tu gzung //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhum pa'i sems ni rab tu gzung // zhes bya ba la /
translated: When the mind is slack, one should tighten it.🔽When the mind is slack,

original: rnal 'byor ba ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa'i dus na sems nyid kyis mi gsal te zhum par gyur na /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ba ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa'i dus na sems nyid kyis mi gsal te zhum par gyur na /
translated: when the yogin's mind is not clear while he is cultivating concentration,

original: lhag mthong mtshan ma yid la byed pas sems gzung zhing gzengs bstod par bya ste /
analyzed: lhag mthong mtshan ma yid la byed pas sems gzung zhing gzengs bstod par bya ste /
translated: he should tighten it, uplift it, by attention to the special point of insight.

original: ji ltar gzengs bstod ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar gzengs bstod ce na /
translated: How does he uplift it?

original: lhag mthong gis de bzhin gshegs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi yon tan dang / chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid yid la bya bas sems gzengs bstod par bya ste /
analyzed: lhag mthong gis de bzhin gshegs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi yon tan dang / chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid yid la bya bas sems gzengs bstod par bya ste /
translated: He uplifts it by attention to the special point of the Tathagata, the virtues of concentration, and the general and special characteristics of things.

original: 'dis ni 'dzin pa'i mtshan ma yid la byed pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'dzin pa'i mtshan ma yid la byed pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the attention to the special point of retention.

original: rgod pa yang ni zhi par bya //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rgod pa yang ni zhi par bya // zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should also pacify agitation.

original: sngon mthong ba dang thos pa la sogs pa dran nas phyi'i yul la sems 'phros par gyur na zhi gnas kyi mtshan ma yid la byed pas rgod pa zhi bar bya ste /
analyzed: sngon mthong ba dang thos pa la sogs pa dran nas phyi'i yul la sems 'phros par gyur na zhi gnas kyi mtshan ma yid la byed pas rgod pa zhi bar bya ste /
translated: When the mind is distracted to external objects by recalling what was previously seen, heard, etc., one should pacify agitation by attending to the sign of serenity.

original: ji ltar yid la bya zhen /
analyzed: ji ltar yid la bya zhen /
translated: How does one attend to it?

original: 'khor ba'i skyon skye ba dang rga ba la sogs pa bsams nas sems g-yeng ba spang bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i skyon skye ba dang rga ba la sogs pa bsams nas sems g-yeng ba spang bar bya ste /
translated: Having contemplated the faults of cyclic existence, such as birth, aging, etc., one should abandon distraction.

original: 'dis ni zhi gnas kyi mtshan ma yid la byed pa bstan to //🔽gang du dmigs pa de la yang //
analyzed: 'dis ni zhi gnas kyi mtshan ma yid la byed pa bstan to // gang du dmigs pa de la yang //
translated: This shows the attention to the sign of serenity.

original: mnyam pa thob nas btang snyoms te //🔽zhes bya ba la /🔽rnal 'byor pas de ltar zhum pa'i sems ni lhag mthong gis spangs /
analyzed: mnyam pa thob nas btang snyoms te // zhes bya ba la / rnal 'byor pas de ltar zhum pa'i sems ni lhag mthong gis spangs /
translated: When one attains equanimity toward that object, one should be equanimous.

original: rgod pa'i sems ni zhi gnas kyis spangs te /
analyzed: rgod pa'i sems ni zhi gnas kyis spangs te /
translated: When the yogin has thus abandoned a contracted mind by means of insight and has abandoned an agitated mind by means of serenity,

original: dmigs par bya ba'i yul la zhum rgod med bar gyur nas sems mnyam pa nyid du gyur na mi bskyod par btang snyoms su bzhag ste /
analyzed: dmigs par bya ba'i yul la zhum rgod med bar gyur nas sems mnyam pa nyid du gyur na mi bskyod par btang snyoms su bzhag ste /
translated: and when he has attained an equanimity of mind toward the object of meditation, he should be equanimous and remain unmoved.

original: zhi gnas kyi mtshan ma yang yid la mi bya lhag mthong gi mtshan ma yang yid la mi bya ste /
analyzed: zhi gnas kyi mtshan ma yang yid la mi bya lhag mthong gi mtshan ma yang yid la mi bya ste /
translated: One should not attend to the signs of serenity, nor should one attend to the signs of insight.

original: gal te 'ga' zhig yid la byas pa na /
analyzed: gal te 'ga' zhig yid la byas pa na /
translated: If one attends to any of them,

original: mnyam pa nyid kyi sems las nyams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid kyi sems las nyams par 'gyur te /
translated: one will fall from the mind of equanimity.

original: 'dis ni btang snyoms kyi mtshan ma yid la byed pa bstan to ;

analyzed: lugs las bzlog ste 'jug pa dang / thod rgal du 'jug pa'o // mngon par shes pa las su rang ba'i mchog thob pa ni /

translated: The highest flexibility of the superknowledges is the ability to engage in the activities of the superknowledges, such as the superknowledge of the divine eye, without obstruction.

analyzed: bsam gtan mngon shes rdzogs pas na // sangs rgyas rnams las mnyan pa dang // dpag tu med par mchod pa'i phyir //

analyzed: 'jig rten khams su de 'gro'o // zhes bya ba la /

original: de ltar bsam gtan mchog thob ste /
analyzed: de ltar bsam gtan mchog thob ste /
translated: Having thus obtained the supreme meditative stabilization,

analyzed: bsam gtan rdzogs pa dang / mngon par shes pa mchog thob ste / mngon par shes pa'i rdzogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rdzu 'phrul can te /
translated: he has perfected meditative stabilization and having obtained the supreme higher perception,🔽he has perfected higher perception.🔽The bodhisattva who has perfected meditative stabilization and higher perception has miraculous powers and he goes to the world systems through his miraculous powers.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyis 'jig rten gyi khams su 'gro'o zhes bya bar sbyar te ci'i phyir de 'gro zhe na /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyis 'jig rten gyi khams su 'gro'o zhes bya bar sbyar te ci'i phyir de 'gro zhe na /

analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams na bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa las dam pa'i chos nyan pa'i sgo nas /
translated: In order to listen to the sublime Dharma from the tathagatas who reside in the world systems of the ten directions and

original: ye shes kyi tshogs rdzogs par bya ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa de dag la bsod snyoms dang chos gos la sogs pa zang zing gis mchod par byas pa'i sgo nas bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags par bya ba'i phyir /

translated: In order to complete the accumulation of wisdom and in order to complete the accumulation of merit by means of material offerings such as alms-food and Dharma robes to those Tathagatas,

original: 'jig rten gyi khams kun du 'gro'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams kun du 'gro'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: he goes to all the world-realms. This is the meaning.

original: sangs rgyas dpag tu med pa la //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dpag tu med pa la //
translated: Inconceivable, immeasurable Buddhas

original: bskal pa grangs med de snyed na //
analyzed: bskal pa grangs med de snyed na //
translated: for that many countless eons,

original: las su rung ba'i mchog thob na //
analyzed: las su rung ba'i mchog thob na //
translated: having attained the highest state of flexibility,

original: de las bsnyen pa'i sems kyis so //🔽zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa de dag la zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: bsnyen pa'i sems kyis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bsnyen pa'i sems kyis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: With a mind of reverence means

analyzed: sangs rgyas la bkur sti dang mchod pa bya'o snyam du bsam pa'i sems kyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: with a mind thinking I will honor and make offerings to the Buddhas.

analyzed: 'di lta bu'i sems kyis phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas dpag tu med pa la bskal pa grangs med pa gcig tu dam pa'i chos mnyam pa dang / lhung bzed dang chos gos la sogs pa 'bul ba'i sgo nas bsnyen bkur byas nas las su rung ba'i mchog thob par 'gyur te /
translated: With such a mind, for one incalculable eon, they honor immeasurable buddhas of the ten directions by listening to the excellent Dharma and by offering them alms bowls, Dharma robes, and so on.

original: de'ang gang zhen /
analyzed: de'ang gang zhen /
translated: What is that?

original: phyogs bcu thams cad du rdzu 'phrul gyis de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa bya ba dang / thogs pa med par nus pa'i mngon par shes pa la bskyed nus pa'i bsam gtan las su rung ba'i mchog thob po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyogs bcu thams cad du rdzu 'phrul gyis de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa bya ba dang / thogs pa med par nus pa'i mngon par shes pa la bskyed nus pa'i bsam gtan las su rung ba'i mchog thob po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is the supreme flexibility of concentration that is able to generate the superknowledge of unhindered power and to make offerings to tathagatas through miracles in all ten directions.

original: bskal pa grangs med pa zhes bya ba ni @269a * //
analyzed: bskal pa grangs med pa zhes bya ba ni @269a * //
translated: An incalculable eon means

original: bgrad ba dpag tu med pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bgrad ba dpag tu med pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: an eon that is beyond counting.

original: 'di'i skabs su bskal pa grangs med pa 'byung ba zhes 'byung ba grangs med pa gsum la ni mi bya'i //
analyzed: 'di'i skabs su bskal pa grangs med pa 'byung ba zhes 'byung ba grangs med pa gsum la ni mi bya'i //
translated: In this context, an incalculable eon is not the three incalculable eons that occur in the sutras.

original: bgrang ba las 'das pa'i bskal pa grangs med pa gcig la bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bgrang ba las 'das pa'i bskal pa grangs med pa gcig la bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: One should understand that it is in one incalculable eon.

original: de nas de dag sngon rol du //
analyzed: de nas de dag sngon rol du //
translated: Then, prior to that,

original: yon tan lnga ni 'thob 'gyur te //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yon tan lnga ni 'thob 'gyur te // zhes bya ba la /
translated: one obtains the five qualities.🔽One obtains the serviceability of body and mind, the perfection of the meditative stabilizations and superknowledges, and the worship of the Tathagatas.

original: lus dang sems las su rung ba thob pa dang / bsam gtan mngon par shes pa rdzogs pa thob pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa dpag tu med pa thob pa'i 'og tu de lta bu dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' des bsam pa rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: lus dang sems las su rung ba thob pa dang / bsam gtan mngon par shes pa rdzogs pa thob pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa dpag tu med pa thob pa'i 'og tu de lta bu dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' des bsam pa rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: Then, after that, the bodhisattva who is endowed with such qualities has a pure intention.

original: sa dang po ma thob pa'i snga rol du /
analyzed: sa dang po ma thob pa'i snga rol du /
translated: Prior to obtaining the first stage,

original: sa dang po thob par 'gyur ba'i mtshan ma yon tan lnga thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sa dang po thob par 'gyur ba'i mtshan ma yon tan lnga thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: one obtains the five qualities that are the signs of the attainment of the first stage.

original: rnam par dag pa'i snod 'gyur zhing //🔽de nas bla na med par 'gyur //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i snod 'gyur zhing // de nas bla na med par 'gyur //
translated: One becomes a vessel for purification

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: and then one becomes unsurpassed.

original: yon tan rnam pa lnga thob nas kyang rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: yon tan rnam pa lnga thob nas kyang rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: Having obtained the five qualities, one is purified.

original: sa rab tu dga' ba dang chos kyi sku rdzogs pa dang / dag par 'gyur ba'i snod dang / gzhi bla na med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sa rab tu dga' ba dang chos kyi sku rdzogs pa dang / dag par 'gyur ba'i snod dang / gzhi bla na med par 'gyur te /
translated: The Joyful level is attained, the Dharma body is perfected, one becomes a vessel for purity, and one becomes a basis that is unsurpassed.

original: bla na med pa zhes smos pas ni /
analyzed: bla na med pa zhes smos pas ni /
translated: Since it is said to be unsurpassed,

analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'i sgo nas zhugs pa ni ma yin gyi dang po thob par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: it is not attained through the vehicles of the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: theg pa chen po'i sgo nas zhugs pas na snod bla na med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i sgo nas zhugs pas na snod bla na med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since it is attained through the vehicle of the Mahayana, it is called the unsurpassed vessel.

original: gang phyir lus kyi gnas ngan len //
analyzed: gang phyir lus kyi gnas ngan len //
translated: The body's negative reflex actions

original: skad cig re rer kun spyod dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: skad cig re rer kun spyod dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: are eliminated in every moment.

original: yon tan rnam pa lnga ston to //
analyzed: yon tan rnam pa lnga ston to //
translated: This shows the five aspects of the qualities.

analyzed: lus kyi gnas ngan len gyi sgras ni lus las su mi rung ba dang / sems las su mi rung ba gnyis la bya ste /
translated: The term negative reflex actions of the body refers to both the body's unserviceability and the mind's unserviceability.

original: lus las su mi rung ba ni lus lci ba dang / mi bde ba'o //
analyzed: lus las su mi rung ba ni lus lci ba dang / mi bde ba'o //
translated: The body's unserviceability is the heaviness and discomfort of the body.

original: sems las su mi rung ba ni sems mi bde zhing dge ba la mi 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: sems las su mi rung ba ni sems mi bde zhing dge ba la mi 'jog pa'o //
translated: The mind's unserviceability is the discomfort of the mind and the inability to focus on virtue.

original: dper na khrus mkhan gyis khrus rtsi dang chos gos dang ras la sogs pa'i dri ma skad cig ma re re la 'dag cing spyod bar byed pa de bzhin du de dag kyang zhi gnas chu dang 'dra bas lus las su mi rung ba skad cig ma re
analyzed: dper na khrus mkhan gyis khrus rtsi dang chos gos dang ras la sogs pa'i dri ma skad cig ma re re la 'dag cing spyod bar byed pa de bzhin du de dag kyang zhi gnas chu dang 'dra bas lus las su mi rung ba skad cig ma re
translated: For example, a bath attendant cleanses and uses up the dirt of the bath powder, soap, and cloth, etc.🔽in each moment.

original: re la 'dag cing spyong bar byed do //
analyzed: re la 'dag cing spyong bar byed do //
translated: In the same way, they cleanse and use up the unfitness of the body in each moment, with the water of serenity.

original: 'di ni yon tan rnam pa gcig go //🔽lus dang sems kyis kun du yang //
analyzed: 'di ni yon tan rnam pa gcig go // lus dang sems kyis kun du yang //
translated: This is one kind of quality.

original: shin tu sbyangs pas gang bar 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pas gang bar 'gyur // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The body and mind become filled with fitness.

analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa'i sgras ni las su rung ba la bya ste /
translated: The word fitness refers to flexibility.🔽In fact, the body becomes flexible and the happiness of the body pervades and fills the body.

original: don du na lus las su rung bar bya zhing lus kyi bde bas kyang lus kun du khyab cing @269b dang bar 'gyur ba dang / sems las su rung zhing sems bde bas kyang sems kun du khyab par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //

translated: The mind becomes flexible and the happiness of the mind pervades and fills the mind.🔽This is the meaning.

analyzed: lus shin tu sbyangs pa dang / sems shin tu sbyangs pa gnyis so sor phye ste /
translated: The two, physical pliancy and mental pliancy, are distinguished.

original: yon tan gsum du bzhag go //
analyzed: yon tan gsum du bzhag go //
translated: They are posited as three qualities.

original: de la lus kyi gnas ngan len spyang ba dang / lus las su rung ba dang / sems las su rung ba gsum ni zhi gnas kyi phyogs so //
analyzed: de la lus kyi gnas ngan len spyang ba dang / lus las su rung ba dang / sems las su rung ba gsum ni zhi gnas kyi phyogs so //
translated: Among them, the three, the purification of the bad physical states, the serviceability of the body, and the serviceability of the mind, are the side of serenity.

original: thams cad chos dag shes pa ni //
analyzed: thams cad chos dag shes pa ni //
translated: The knowledge of all phenomena

original: yongs su ma chad snang bar ro //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yongs su ma chad snang bar ro // zhes bya ba la /
translated: is the appearance of the unbroken.

original: chos kyi sgras ni mdo sde la sogs pa gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis la bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sgras ni mdo sde la sogs pa gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis la bya'o //
translated: With regard to that, the term “phenomena” refers to the twelve branches of the scriptures such as the sūtras.

original: des kha cig shes /
analyzed: des kha cig shes /
translated: Some do not know it,

original: kha cig mi shes pa dang / bar 'ga' shes par 'ga' mi shes pa ni ma yin gyi dus thams cad du thams cad shes pa ni yongs su ma chad pa snang ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: kha cig mi shes pa dang / bar 'ga' shes par 'ga' mi shes pa ni ma yin gyi dus thams cad du thams cad shes pa ni yongs su ma chad pa snang ba zhes bya ste /
translated: and some do not know it at some times, but it is not that they do not know it at all times. The knowledge of all phenomena at all times is called the appearance of the unbroken.

original: de ltar lus dang sems las su rung bar gyur pa dang / gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis ni chos thams cad la yongs su ma chad pa'i tshul du shes pa'i snang ba 'byung ste /

translated: Thus, when body and mind become serviceable, and the twelve branches of excellent speech are understood as the light of knowledge that is not cut off with respect to all phenomena.

original: 'di ni yon tan rnam pa bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni yon tan rnam pa bzhi pa'o //
translated: This is the fourth good quality.

original: rnam par dag pa'i mtshan ma yang //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i mtshan ma yang //
translated: The signs of purification

original: ma brtags par ni rab tu mthong //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ma brtags par ni rab tu mthong // zhes bya ba la /
translated: are seen without examination.

original: rnam par dag pa'i sgras ni sa dang po la bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i sgras ni sa dang po la bya ste /
translated: Here, the term “purification” refers to the first ground.

translated: The signs and marks of attaining the first ground are that one sees in dreams, without examination or thought, the purification of the body’s faults, such as worms emerging from the body and washing the body after it has been smeared with filth.

original: 'di ni yon tan lnga ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni yon tan lnga ba'o //
translated: This is the fifth good quality.

original: de ltar chos thams cad la yongs su ma chad pa'i snang ba thob pa dang / rnam par dag pa'i mtshan ma ma brtags par mthong ba gnyis ni lhag mthong gi phyogs so //

translated: Thus, the attainment of the appearance of all dharmas without exception and the non-examination of the pure signs that are seen are the side of insight.

original: rtag tu blo ldan byed pa ni //
analyzed: rtag tu blo ldan byed pa ni //
translated: The wise always practice

original: rab tu rdzogs dang rnam dag pa'i //
analyzed: rab tu rdzogs dang rnam dag pa'i //
translated: the cause for the complete perfection

original: mdor na chos kyi sku yi ste //
analyzed: mdor na chos kyi sku yi ste //
translated: and purity of the dharmakāya

original: rgyu ni de bzhin yongs su 'dzin //
analyzed: rgyu ni de bzhin yongs su 'dzin //
translated: in brief, it is the cause for the retention of the Tathāgata.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: de'i 'og tu byang chub sems dpa' blo dang ldan pas rnam pa yongs su 'dzin par byed de /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu byang chub sems dpa' blo dang ldan pas rnam pa yongs su 'dzin par byed de /

analyzed: gang zhen chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs pa'i sku rgyu dang / rnam par dag pa'i rgyu ste /
translated: What are they? The cause for the complete perfection of the dharmakāya and the cause for its purity.

analyzed: rgyu ni de bzhin gshegs pa grangs med pa las bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa'am /
translated: The cause is the accumulation of the stores of merit and wisdom from countless tathāgatas.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ni phyogs la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ni phyogs la gnas pa ste /
translated: Śamatha and vipaśyanā are the bases for the side.

analyzed: de bas na rnam par dag pa'i snod bla na med par 'gyur ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said to be the unsurpassed vessel for purity.

original: 'di ni zhi @270a * //
analyzed: 'di ni zhi @270a * //
translated: This is peace.🔽🔽

original: gnas dang lhag mthong gnyi ga'i phyogs so //
analyzed: gnas dang lhag mthong gnyi ga'i phyogs so //

analyzed: sa bcu'i dus na ni chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya ste /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i chos kyi sku ni sa bcu bar rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the Bodhisattva’s Dharma Body is perfected on the ten stages.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa'i dus na ni chos kyi sku rnam par dag pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa'i dus na ni chos kyi sku rnam par dag pa zhes bya ste /
translated: On the Buddha stage, the Dharma Body is said to be purified,

original: dar la tsam gyis chod pa'i sgrib pa yang spangs pa'i chos kyi sku thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dar la tsam gyis chod pa'i sgrib pa yang spangs pa'i chos kyi sku thob pa'i phyir ro //

translated: Thus, having understood that all these appearances and perceptions of external objects are merely the mind appearing in that way, one abides in the non-appearance of any external thing.

analyzed: de bas na sems tsam la gnas pa zhes bya'o //

analyzed: gang gi tshe de la gnas nas yul lta bur sems la snang ba thams cad spangs te /
translated: When one abides in that, all appearances of objects in the mind are abandoned and🔽become non-apparent. At that time, the distraction of grasping is abandoned.

translated: This teaches the samādhi that is one-sided suchness.

translated: When the light of the Dharma increases,🔽starting from here,

translated: up to:

analyzed: de spangs pa'i de ma thag pa'i ting nge 'dzin myur du thob par byed de /

analyzed: 'di ni 'jig rten gyi chos mchog gi dus so //

translated: After that, the factors conducive to penetration

analyzed: zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: bdag dang spyi'i mtshan nyid gnyis yid kyi rtog pa tsam du mthong ba de ni drod la bab ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: That seeing of the two, the general and specific characteristics, as mere mental conceptualization is the arrival at warmth.

translated: The intrinsic identity of phenomena is the intrinsic identity of form, which is to be attained, and the intrinsic identity of feeling, which is the nature of experience, and so on.

translated: It is the identity of that which is contaminated, uncontaminated, compounded, uncompounded, visible, invisible, obstructed, and unobstructed, and so on.

analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa ste /
translated: The general identity is impermanence, suffering, emptiness, and no-self.

translated: When one sees that all of these are merely mental fabrications and that they do not exist apart from mental fabrications, at that time one is said to have attained the stage of warmth.

analyzed: drod ces kyang bya /

analyzed: chos la snang ba thob pa zhes kyang bya /

analyzed: drod dang chos la snang ba thob pa de la chos la rtog pa bzod pa zhes bya bar ci mngon zhe na /

translated: The expression “the appearance of phenomena” is a term for the acceptance of the investigation of phenomena.🔽The attainment of the appearance of phenomena is called the attainment of the acceptance of the investigation of phenomena.

translated: The attainment of the appearance of phenomena is called the attainment of the acceptance of the investigation of phenomena.

original: de la ba tsha'i chu bo ni khams gsum du rgyun du 'khor ba la bya'o //
analyzed: de la ba tsha'i chu bo ni khams gsum du rgyun du 'khor ba la bya'o //
translated: The river of salt water is explained as the river of cyclic existence in the three realms.

original: ba tshva'i chu bo'i tha ma ba tshva'i skye bo la nyi ma'i zer bab na dkar ba dang skya bar snang ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: ba tshva'i chu bo'i tha ma ba tshva'i skye bo la nyi ma'i zer bab na dkar ba dang skya bar snang ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as when the sun's rays fall on the last of the salt waters, they appear white and pale,

original: gang gi tshe chos thams cad sems las snang bar zad kyi /
analyzed: gang gi tshe chos thams cad sems las snang bar zad kyi /
translated: so too, when one understands that all phenomena are only appearances of the mind,

original: sems las logs shig na yod pa ma yin no zhes khong du chud pa de'i tshe nyi ma dang zla @271b pa'i 'od lta bur snang ba zhes ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: sems las logs shig na yod pa ma yin no zhes khong du chud pa de'i tshe nyi ma dang zla @271b pa'i 'od lta bur snang ba zhes ni mi bya'o //
translated: and do not exist apart from the mind, then it is not said that they appear like the light of the sun and moon.

original: chos la snang ba thob pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos la snang ba thob pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is said that one has attained the light of the Dharma. This is the meaning.

original: de chos kyi snang ba de nyid 'phel ba'i phyir te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de chos kyi snang ba de nyid 'phel ba'i phyir te zhes bya ba la /
translated: In order to increase that very light of the Dharma,

translated: in order to increase and expand that very attainment of the light of the Dharma, the thought that apart from the conceptualization of the bodhisattva, there is no other entity of an object, the bodhisattva exerts effort without abiding or remaining in any place whatsoever.

original: de ni rtse mo'i dus so zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni rtse mo'i dus so zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the stage of the peak.

original: chos kyi snang ba 'phel nas 'di dag kun sems tsam mo zhes rtog pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: chos kyi snang ba 'phel nas 'di dag kun sems tsam mo zhes rtog pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Having increased the light of the Dharma, one imagines that all this is mind only.🔽Having attained the light of the Dharma by understanding that all this is mind only, one increases that light by the practice of effort.

original: de ltar sems tsam du rtogs pa'i chos kyi snang ba thob nas snang ba de nyid shas cher 'phel ba'i brtson 'grus brtsams pa las sems tsam du rtog pa'i snang ba shas tsher 'phel ba'i 'og tu phyi'i gzung ba snang ba'i gzung ba thams cad dang bral nas

translated: After the light of the imagination of mind only has increased, one becomes free from the appearance of all external objects.

original: sems tsam du rtog shing sems la gnas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems tsam du rtog shing sems la gnas par 'gyur te /
translated: One imagines that it is mind only and one remains in the mind.

original: gang gi tshe bzung ba'i g-yeng ba spangs nas 'dzin pa'i g-yeng ba tsam la gnas pa thob pa'i tshe bzod pa thob pa'i dus zhes bya'o //

analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin du khyad par med do zhes rtogs pas na sdug bsngal mnyam pa nyid rtogs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: There is no difference in their nature of suffering.

original: bdag med pa mnyam pa nyid rtogs pa dang / sdug bsngal mnyam pa nyid rtogs pa gnyis kyis ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa rtogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: bdag med pa mnyam pa nyid rtogs pa dang / sdug bsngal mnyam pa nyid rtogs pa gnyis kyis ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa rtogs pa bstan to //
translated: Realizing the sameness of suffering is explained in two ways: realizing the sameness of selflessness and realizing the sameness of suffering.🔽These two explain the realization of the truth of suffering.

original: de la sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa'i rnam pa ste /
translated: The truth of suffering has four aspects: impermanence, suffering, emptiness and selflessness.

original: rnam pa bzhi ltar rtogs na sdug bsngal gyi bden pa rtogs pa yin na rnam pa gnyis ltar rtogs pas ji ltar sdug bsngal gyi bden pa rtogs par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi ltar rtogs na sdug bsngal gyi bden pa rtogs pa yin na rnam pa gnyis ltar rtogs pas ji ltar sdug bsngal gyi bden pa rtogs par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If one realizes the truth of suffering by realizing these four aspects, how does one realize the truth of suffering by realizing two aspects?

original: 'di ltar gang mi rtag pa de sdug bsngal yin pas sdug bsngal ba'i nang du mi rtag pa'i rnam pa bsdus pa yin par blta'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang mi rtag pa de sdug bsngal yin pas sdug bsngal ba'i nang du mi rtag pa'i rnam pa bsdus pa yin par blta'o //
translated: Thus, since what is impermanent is suffering, the aspect of impermanence is included in the aspect of suffering.

original: gang bdag med pa de stong pa yin pas bdag med pa'i rnam pa'i nang du stong pa'i rnam pa yang bsdus par blta ste /
analyzed: gang bdag med pa de stong pa yin pas bdag med pa'i rnam pa'i nang du stong pa'i rnam pa yang bsdus par blta ste /
translated: Since what is insubstantial is empty, the aspect of emptiness is included in the aspect of insubstantiality.

original: de ltar na bden pa'i rnam pa bzhi char rtogs par zhar gyis bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar na bden pa'i rnam pa bzhi char rtogs par zhar gyis bstan to //
translated: Thus, the four aspects of the four noble truths are taught by implication.

original: bdag dang pha rol gyi sdug bsngal mnyam par @273b 'dod pa mtshungs pa'i phyir byed pa mnyam pa dang zhes bya ba la /🔽ji ltar bdag gi sdug bsngal gyi phung po dang / sdug bsngal bskyed pa'i rgyu kun 'byung gi bden pa spong bar byed par 'dod cing /
analyzed: bdag dang pha rol gyi sdug bsngal mnyam par @273b 'dod pa mtshungs pa'i phyir byed pa mnyam pa dang zhes bya ba la / ji ltar bdag gi sdug bsngal gyi phung po dang / sdug bsngal bskyed pa'i rgyu kun 'byung gi bden pa spong bar byed par 'dod cing /
translated: The equality of action refers to the equality of desire, since one desires the same for oneself and others.🔽Just as one desires to abandon the mass of suffering and the truth of origin, which is the cause of suffering,

original: byed pa de bzhin du sems can gyi sdug bsngal gyi phung po dang / de skyed par byed pa'i rgyu kun 'byung gi bden pa yang spong bar byed cing 'dod de /
analyzed: byed pa de bzhin du sems can gyi sdug bsngal gyi phung po dang / de skyed par byed pa'i rgyu kun 'byung gi bden pa yang spong bar byed cing 'dod de /
translated: so one desires to abandon the mass of suffering of sentient beings and the truth of origin, which is the cause of that suffering.

original: de bas na byed pa mnyam pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de bas na byed pa mnyam pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, it is called the sameness of action.

original: 'dis ni kun 'byung gi bden pa spong bar byed pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni kun 'byung gi bden pa spong bar byed pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the abandonment of the truth of origination.

original: bdag la ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: bdag la ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: Just as with oneself,

original: gzhan la lan mi re ba'i phyir lan re ba med pa mnyam pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhan la lan mi re ba'i phyir lan re ba med pa mnyam pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: there is the sameness of not expecting anything in return.

original: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' bdag nyid kyis lam gyi bden pa dang / 'gog pa'i bden pa la bkod de /
analyzed: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' bdag nyid kyis lam gyi bden pa dang / 'gog pa'i bden pa la bkod de /
translated: Just as the bodhisattva, having established himself in the truth of the path and in the truth of cessation,

original: phan pa dam pas phan btags kyang bdag la phan btags pa'i lan re ba med pa bzhin du sems can gzhan lam gyi bden pa dang 'gog pa'i bden pa la bkod de /
analyzed: phan pa dam pas phan btags kyang bdag la phan btags pa'i lan re ba med pa bzhin du sems can gzhan lam gyi bden pa dang 'gog pa'i bden pa la bkod de /
translated: benefits others with the highest benefit, but does not expect anything in return for the benefit he has given, so he establishes other sentient beings in the truth of the path and in the truth of cessation,

original: phan pa dam pas phan btags kyang phan btags so snyam du mi dgongs shing phan btags pa'i lan la mi re ba ste /
analyzed: phan pa dam pas phan btags kyang phan btags so snyam du mi dgongs shing phan btags pa'i lan la mi re ba ste /
translated: and benefits them with the highest benefit, but does not think, “I have benefited them,” and does not expect anything in return for the benefit he has given.

original: de bas na lan re ba med pa mnyam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na lan re ba med pa mnyam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the sameness of not expecting anything in return.

original: 'dis ni lam gyi bden pa bsgom pa dang 'gog pa'i bden pa mngon du byed pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni lam gyi bden pa bsgom pa dang 'gog pa'i bden pa mngon du byed pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the cultivation of the truth of the path and the realization of the truth of cessation.

original: ji ltar de dag gis mngon par rtogs pa de bzhin du mngon par rtogs bas gzhan dang mnyam pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ji ltar de dag gis mngon par rtogs pa de bzhin du mngon par rtogs bas gzhan dang mnyam pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Just as they have realized it, so too have others who have realized it in the same way.

original: ji ltar sa dang por zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis chos kyi dbyings rtogs shing bdag dang gzhan du mnyam pa nyid kyi sems rtogs pa de bzhin du sa dang por zhugs pa byang chub sems dpa' des kyang /
analyzed: ji ltar sa dang por zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis chos kyi dbyings rtogs shing bdag dang gzhan du mnyam pa nyid kyi sems rtogs pa de bzhin du sa dang por zhugs pa byang chub sems dpa' des kyang /
translated: Just as those Bodhisattvas who have entered the first stage have realized the Dharma-element and have realized the thought of sameness with regard to self and others, so too has the Bodhisattva who has entered the first stage.

original: chos kyi dbyings rtogs shing bdag dang gzhan du mnyam pa nyid kyi sems rtogs te /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rtogs shing bdag dang gzhan du mnyam pa nyid kyi sems rtogs te /
translated: He has realized the Dharma-element and has realized the thought of sameness with regard to self and others.

original: sa dang por zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gzhan dang rtogs pa 'dra bas na byang chub sems dpa' gzhan dang mnyam pa zhes bya'o //🔽des ni khams gsum 'dus byas rnams //
analyzed: sa dang por zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gzhan dang rtogs pa 'dra bas na byang chub sems dpa' gzhan dang mnyam pa zhes bya'o // des ni khams gsum 'dus byas rnams //
translated: Because he has realized the same as the other Bodhisattvas who have entered the first stage, he is said to be equal to other Bodhisattvas.

original: yang dag ma yin kun rtog par //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang dag ma yin kun rtog par //🔽zhes bya ba la /
translated: The Imagined Is Not In The Nature Of The Ultimate🔽The Imagined Is Not In The Nature Of The Ultimate🔽The Imagined Is Not In The Nature Of The Ultimate🔽The Imagined Is Not In The Nature Of The Ultimate

original: des zhes bya ba ni sa dang po thob cing mnyam pa nyid rnam pa lnga thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni sa dang po thob cing mnyam pa nyid rnam pa lnga thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The “he” refers to the bodhisattva who has attained the first stage and attained the five types of sameness.

original: khams gsum gyi 'dus byas zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi phung po lnga dang gzugs kyi khams kyi phung po lnga dang / gzugs med pa'i khams kyi phung po bzhi la sogs pa @274a * //
analyzed: khams gsum gyi 'dus byas zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi phung po lnga dang gzugs kyi khams kyi phung po lnga dang / gzugs med pa'i khams kyi phung po bzhi la sogs pa @274a * //
translated: The “conditioned of the three realms” refers to the five aggregates of the desire realm, the five aggregates of the form realm, and the four aggregates of the formless realm, and so on.

original: khams gsum pa'i chos thams cad yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun du rtog pa tsam du mthong ste /
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i chos thams cad yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun du rtog pa tsam du mthong ste /
translated: He sees all phenomena of the three realms as mere unreal imagination.

original: sems las byung ba zad pa tsam du mthong gi /
analyzed: sems las byung ba zad pa tsam du mthong gi /
translated: He sees that they are merely exhausted mental factors.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba las ma gtogs pa'i chos gang yang yod pa ma yin par mthong ste /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba las ma gtogs pa'i chos gang yang yod pa ma yin par mthong ste /
translated: He sees that there are no phenomena apart from mind and mental factors.

original: de bas nas bcu'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: de bas nas bcu'i mdo las kyang /
translated: Therefore, the Sūtra of the Ten Stages also says:

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag khams gsum 'di dag ni sems tsam me zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag khams gsum 'di dag ni sems tsam me zhes gsungs so //
translated: “O sons of the victors, these three realms are mind only.”

original: sems tsam du ye shes gang gis mthong zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: sems tsam du ye shes gang gis mthong zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: By what wisdom does one see that it is mind only?

original: ye shes rab tu rnam dag pa //
analyzed: ye shes rab tu rnam dag pa //
translated: The wisdom that is utterly pure

original: mi gnyis don gyis mthong bar 'gyur //🔽zhes smos te /
analyzed: mi gnyis don gyis mthong bar 'gyur // zhes smos te /
translated: sees the nondual meaning.

original: 'dus byas sems tsam du yang rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes shin tu rnam par dag pa mi gnyis pas mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'dus byas sems tsam du yang rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes shin tu rnam par dag pa mi gnyis pas mthong ngo //
translated: The nonconceptual wisdom that is utterly pure sees the conditioned as mind only.

original: de la ye shes de 'jig rten las 'das pa rnam par mi rtog pa yin pas na /
analyzed: de la ye shes de 'jig rten las 'das pa rnam par mi rtog pa yin pas na /
translated: Since that wisdom is supramundane and nonconceptual,

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: it is called “utterly pure.”

original: ye shes des gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med pa'i don mthong zhing gzung 'dzin gnyis ye shes de la med pas na mi gnyis pa'i don zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ye shes des gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med pa'i don mthong zhing gzung 'dzin gnyis ye shes de la med pas na mi gnyis pa'i don zhes bya'o //
translated: Since that wisdom sees the meaning of the absence of apprehended and apprehender and the duality of apprehended and apprehender does not exist for that wisdom, it is called “the meaning of nonduality.”

original: don du rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis ni khams gsum gyi chos thams cad nam mkha'i ngos bzhin du mthong ngo //
analyzed: don du rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis ni khams gsum gyi chos thams cad nam mkha'i ngos bzhin du mthong ngo //
translated: The nonconceptual wisdom that is the meaning sees all phenomena of the three realms as being like the surface of the sky.

original: dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes kyis ni khams gsum pa'i 'dus byas thams cad sems dang sems las byung ba tsam du zad par mthong ngo //
analyzed: dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes kyis ni khams gsum pa'i 'dus byas thams cad sems dang sems las byung ba tsam du zad par mthong ngo //
translated: Pure mundane wisdom sees all conditioned phenomena of the three realms as being mind and mental factors alone.

original: de med pa yi yod pa de //
analyzed: de med pa yi yod pa de //
translated: That existence of the non-existence of that

original: mthong ba'i spangs pas rnam par dag / ces bya ba la /
analyzed: mthong ba'i spangs pas rnam par dag / ces bya ba la /
translated: is seen as the purity of abandonment.

original: de med pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis med pa'o //
analyzed: de med pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis med pa'o //
translated: The non-existence of that refers to the non-existence of the duality of the apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: yod pa ni gzung 'dzin spangs pa'i stong pa nyid phyi nas yod pa ste /
analyzed: yod pa ni gzung 'dzin spangs pa'i stong pa nyid phyi nas yod pa ste /
translated: The existence of that is the existence of emptiness, which is the abandonment of the apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: sa dang po mthong ba'i lam skyes pa'i dus na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis dang bral ba'i stong pa yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs te /
analyzed: sa dang po mthong ba'i lam skyes pa'i dus na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis dang bral ba'i stong pa yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs te /
translated: When the first spiritual level arises, which is the path of vision, one sees the existence of the perfected nature, which is emptiness, free from the duality of the apprehended object and apprehending subject, and one abandons all the moral defilements that are to be abandoned by the path of vision.

original: rnam par dag pa yin par de'i tshe na mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa yin par de'i tshe na mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: At that time, one sees the purity. This is the meaning.

original: des ni mthong ba'i lam thob ces //
analyzed: des ni mthong ba'i lam thob ces //
translated: It is said that one obtains the path of vision

original: gang phyir de tshe brjod pa'o //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang phyir de tshe brjod pa'o //🔽zhes bya ba la /
translated: because of that at that time.

original: gang gi tshe gzung 'dzin dang bral ba'i stong pa nyid mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs par mthong ba de'i tshe mthong ba'i lam thob pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi tshe gzung 'dzin dang bral ba'i stong pa nyid mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs par mthong ba de'i tshe mthong ba'i lam thob pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: When one sees the abandonment of the afflictions to be abandoned by seeing the emptiness free from subject and object, at that time one has attained the path of seeing. This is the meaning.

original: gzhan yang sa dang po thob pa'i tshe stong pa shes pa brjod de /
analyzed: gzhan yang sa dang po thob pa'i tshe stong pa shes pa brjod de /
translated: Moreover, when one attains the first ground, one is said to know emptiness.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: stong pa rnam gsum shes pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: stong pa rnam gsum shes pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because one knows the three kinds of emptiness.

original: de bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, it is said:

original: dngos po med pa'i stong pa shes //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i stong pa shes //
translated: One knows the emptiness of non-things.

original: zhes bya ba la @274b sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la @274b sogs pa smos so //
translated: And so on.

original: de la dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes kyi kun brtags kyi mtshan nyid 'di dag ni ji ltar byis pa rnams kyis sa'i mtshan nyid sra ba la sogs par brtags pa de ltar med cing stong par shes te //
analyzed: de la dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes kyi kun brtags kyi mtshan nyid 'di dag ni ji ltar byis pa rnams kyis sa'i mtshan nyid sra ba la sogs par brtags pa de ltar med cing stong par shes te //
translated: Therein, one knows that these imagined characteristics of pure mundane wisdom do not exist as they are imagined by the childish, as the characteristic of solidity of earth, and so on, and are empty.

original: de bas na dngos po med pa'i stong pa shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na dngos po med pa'i stong pa shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said one knows the emptiness of non-things.

original: de ltar med pa'i stong pa dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ltar med pa'i stong pa dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: And the emptiness of what does not exist as that.

original: shes zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: shes zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: The meaning of the verse is to be supplied as follows:

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid ni ji ltar so so'i skye bo byis pa rnams kyis gzung ba'i mtshan nyid ji ltar brtags pa de ltar ni med kyi /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid ni ji ltar so so'i skye bo byis pa rnams kyis gzung ba'i mtshan nyid ji ltar brtags pa de ltar ni med kyi /
translated: The relative identity does not exist as it is imagined by naive, ordinary people to exist.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid ni yod do zhes bshad de /🔽de bas na de ltar med pa'i stong pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid ni yod do zhes bshad de / de bas na de ltar med pa'i stong pa zhes bya'o //
translated: But the relative identity does exist.

original: rang bzhin stong ba shes nas ni //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rang bzhin stong ba shes nas ni // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Therefore, it is said to be the emptiness of what does not exist as that.🔽And the emptiness of the essential nature.

original: yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid ni thog ma nas kyang nam mkha'i ngos bzhin du gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa yin te /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid ni thog ma nas kyang nam mkha'i ngos bzhin du gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa yin te /
translated: The perfected identity is empty of the nature of subject and object, like the surface of the sky.

original: yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin thog ma nas stong par shes pa ni rang bzhin stong par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin thog ma nas stong par shes pa ni rang bzhin stong par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: To understand that the perfected nature is empty from the very beginning is called the understanding of the emptiness of the essential nature.

original: stong pa shes pa brjod pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: stong pa shes pa brjod pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The statement, “The understanding of emptiness has been explained,”

original: gong du bshad pa ltar sa dang po'i tshe stong pa rnam pa gsum shes pas na stong pa shes pa zhes brjod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gong du bshad pa ltar sa dang po'i tshe stong pa rnam pa gsum shes pas na stong pa shes pa zhes brjod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: As explained above, since one knows the three kinds of emptiness at the time of the first level, it is said that one knows emptiness.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: As for the meaning of “because they do not exist by their own intrinsic identity,”

original: ji ltar ri bong gi rva dang mo gsham gyi pu la sogs pa la rang gi mtshan nyid med pa de ltar byis pa de kho na ma mthong ba phyin ci log gi blo can rnams kyis sa'i mtshan nyid sra ba la sogs par kun brtags pa dang
analyzed: ji ltar ri bong gi rva dang mo gsham gyi pu la sogs pa la rang gi mtshan nyid med pa de ltar byis pa de kho na ma mthong ba phyin ci log gi blo can rnams kyis sa'i mtshan nyid sra ba la sogs par kun brtags pa dang
translated: and so on, just as a rabbit’s horns and the son of a barren woman do not exist by their own intrinsic identity, in the same way, the childish, who do not see reality, have mistaken minds, and imagine the characteristics of earth to be solidity and so on,

original: / gzung ba dang 'dzin pa lta bur brtags pa de dag mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: / gzung ba dang 'dzin pa lta bur brtags pa de dag mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir /
translated: and imagine them to be like the apprehended and the apprehender, because of the absence of those characteristics,

original: kun brtags kyi rang bzhin stong par shes pa ni ngo bo med pa'i ngo bo stong pa shes pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: kun brtags kyi rang bzhin stong par shes pa ni ngo bo med pa'i ngo bo stong pa shes pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: one knows the emptiness that is the imagined nature to be the emptiness that is the nature of the absence of entity.

original: de ltar med pa'i stong pa ni gzhan gyi dbang gis stong pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de ltar med pa'i stong pa ni gzhan gyi dbang gis stong pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: As for the meaning of “the emptiness of what does not exist in that way is the emptiness of the dependent,” and so on,

original: de ltar med pa'i stong pa ni gzhan gyi dbang gis stong pa la bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar med pa'i stong pa ni gzhan gyi dbang gis stong pa la bya ste /
translated: The emptiness of what does not exist in that way is the emptiness of the other-dependent.

original: dper na sgyu ma'i rta dang glang po la sogs pa rta dang glang po'i rang bzhin du med pas stong yang /
analyzed: dper na sgyu ma'i rta dang glang po la sogs pa rta dang glang po'i rang bzhin du med pas stong yang /
translated: For example, an illusory horse or elephant is empty of the nature of a horse or elephant,🔽but it exists as the essence of a stone or a piece of wood.

original: rdo ba dang shing gi ngo bor yod pa bzhin du gzhan gyi dbang gi rang bzhin la ji ltar byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid du brtags pa ltar med kyi gzhan dbang rang gi mtshan nyid du yod pa ste
analyzed: rdo ba dang shing gi ngo bor yod pa bzhin du gzhan gyi dbang gi rang bzhin la ji ltar byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid du brtags pa ltar med kyi gzhan dbang rang gi mtshan nyid du yod pa ste
translated: In the same way, the other-dependent nature does not exist as the imagined nature, which is the imagined nature of apprehendeds and apprehenders as conceived by naïve ordinary beings, but the other-dependent does exist as its own nature.

original: / de ltar shes pa ni de ltar stong pa med pa'i shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: / de ltar shes pa ni de ltar stong pa med pa'i shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: To know it in that way is called “knowing the emptiness of the consciousness that does not exist in that way.”🔽The completely perfect nature is empty of the emptiness of the other-dependent nature.

original: stong pa'i rang bzhin gyis phyir yongs su rdzogs ba'i ngo bo nyid ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa'o @275a * //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: stong pa'i rang bzhin gyis phyir yongs su rdzogs ba'i ngo bo nyid ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa'o @275a * //🔽zhes bya ba la /
translated: This is the emptiness of the nature of emptiness.

original: yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid ni thog ma nas kyang gzung 'dzin gyi dri ma dang bral zhing rang bzhin gyis stong pa yin te /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid ni thog ma nas kyang gzung 'dzin gyi dri ma dang bral zhing rang bzhin gyis stong pa yin te /
translated: The characteristic of the consummate is that it is primordially free from the stains of percepts and perceivers and is empty of a nature.

original: de la stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin ni de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: de la stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin ni de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid de /
translated: The nature of emptiness is the characteristic of suchness.🔽Since that is the essence that is free from the nature of the imaginary, the nature of emptiness that is free from duality is the consummate.

original: de yang kun du brtags pa'i rang bzhin dang bral ba'i ngo bo yin pas gnyis dang bral ba'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid de ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis so sor rang gis rig par bya ba bstan du med pa bsam gyis mi khyab
analyzed: de yang kun du brtags pa'i rang bzhin dang bral ba'i ngo bo yin pas gnyis dang bral ba'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid de ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis so sor rang gis rig par bya ba bstan du med pa bsam gyis mi khyab
translated: It is to be personally experienced by buddhas and bodhisattvas, is inexpressible, is inconceivable,

original: pa / rtog ge ba'i spyod yul las 'das pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: pa / rtog ge ba'i spyod yul las 'das pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: and is the nature that is beyond the domain of logicians.

original: de ltar khong du chud pa ni rang bzhin gyis stong par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar khong du chud pa ni rang bzhin gyis stong par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: To comprehend it in that way is called “knowing emptiness by nature.”

original: de bas na theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i bstan bcos las kyang /
analyzed: de bas na theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i bstan bcos las kyang /
translated: Therefore, the treatise Compendium of the Mahāyāna says:

original: chos kyi sku ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: chos kyi sku ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The dharmakāya has the characteristic of being inconceivable.

original: de yang rang bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de yang rang bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: This is the characteristic of reality itself.

original: de bzhin nyid de ni so so rang gis rig pa dang / 'jig rten na dpe med pa dang / rtog ge'i spyod yul las 'das nas bsam gyis mi khyab par rig par bya'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid de ni so so rang gis rig pa dang / 'jig rten na dpe med pa dang / rtog ge'i spyod yul las 'das nas bsam gyis mi khyab par rig par bya'o zhes bshad do //
translated: That suchness is to be known as individually realized, as beyond the world, as incomparable in the world, and as inconceivable, since it is beyond the range of speculation.

original: gzhan yang 'phags pa dkon mchog sprin la sogs pa'i mdo sde las don dam pa'i bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas bshad pa'i tshul bzhin du yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid de ltar khong du chud par bya'o //🔽rnam par rtog pa zad pa yi //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'phags pa dkon mchog sprin la sogs pa'i mdo sde las don dam pa'i bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas bshad pa'i tshul bzhin du yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid de ltar khong du chud par bya'o // rnam par rtog pa zad pa yi //
translated: Moreover, the characteristic of the perfected should be understood as it is explained in the sutras, such as the Cloud of Jewels, in terms of the teaching of the ultimate.🔽The knowledge of the object is the exhaustion of conceptualization,

original: dngos po mtshan ma med pas shes //
analyzed: dngos po mtshan ma med pas shes //
translated: because the object is signless.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here now is another explanation.

original: gzhan yang sa dang po'i tshe /
analyzed: gzhan yang sa dang po'i tshe /
translated: At the time of the first stage,

original: 'di ltar khong du chud do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di ltar khong du chud do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: one understands in this way.

original: de la rnam par rtog pa ni yod pa dang med pa dang / gzugs dang / sgra la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa nas mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar du rnam par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: de la rnam par rtog pa ni yod pa dang med pa dang / gzugs dang / sgra la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa nas mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar du rnam par rtog pa ste /
translated: Conceptualization is from the conceptualization of existence and non-existence, form, sound, etc., up to the conceptualization of nirvana.

original: rnam par rtog pa thams cad zad pa'i rnam par rtog pa kun dang bral ba'i de bzhin nyid 'gog pa'i bden pa la bya /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa thams cad zad pa'i rnam par rtog pa kun dang bral ba'i de bzhin nyid 'gog pa'i bden pa la bya /
translated: The reality free from all conceptualization is the truth of cessation.

original: dngos po'i sgras ni dmigs par bya ba'i yul la bya ste /
analyzed: dngos po'i sgras ni dmigs par bya ba'i yul la bya ste /
translated: The word “thing” refers to the objective domain that is to be perceived.

original: de bzhin nyid 'gog pa'i bden pa ni mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis dmigs shing de shes par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid 'gog pa'i bden pa ni mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis dmigs shing de shes par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The reality of cessation is perceived by the samadhof signlessness and it is known.

original: de'ang mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis ni stong pa nyid 'gog pa'i bden pa ste gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i mtshan ma thams cad dang bral bar shes so //
analyzed: de'ang mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis ni stong pa nyid 'gog pa'i bden pa ste gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i mtshan ma thams cad dang bral bar shes so //
translated: That is to say, the samadhof signlessness knows the reality of cessation as emptiness, free from all signs of form, sound, etc.

original: de bas na mngon pa'i chos bsdus pa'i bstan bcos las kyang /
analyzed: de bas na mngon pa'i chos bsdus pa'i bstan bcos las kyang /
translated: Therefore, the treatise Abhidharmasamuccaya says:

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
translated: How should the characteristic of the truth of cessation be understood?

original: de ni gang du 'gags pa dang / gang gis 'gags pa dang / ji ltar 'gags pa shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni gang du 'gags pa dang / gang gis 'gags pa dang / ji ltar 'gags pa shes par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood as that in which there is cessation, that by which there is cessation, and that as cessation.

original: @275b gang du 'gags she na de bzhin du 'gags so //
analyzed: @275b gang du 'gags she na de bzhin du 'gags so //
translated: In which is there cessation? In just that.

original: gang gis 'gags she na lam gyi bden pas 'gags so //
analyzed: gang gis 'gags she na lam gyi bden pas 'gags so //
translated: By what is there cessation? By the truth of the path.

original: gang 'gags she na rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa 'gags so zhes bshad do //
analyzed: gang 'gags she na rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa 'gags so zhes bshad do //
translated: What is there cessation? The cessation of conceptual thought, etc., the afflictions.

original: yang dag ma yin kun rtog pa //
analyzed: yang dag ma yin kun rtog pa //
translated: The imagination of what is unreal

original: de ni smon pa med pas so //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ni smon pa med pas so // zhes bya ba la /
translated: is the absence of expectancy.

original: yang dag ma yin kun rtog ni ;
analyzed: yang dag ma yin kun rtog ni ;
translated: The imagination of what is unreal

original: / gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid ni //
analyzed: / gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid ni //
translated: is the relative identity.

original: de la ni smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis dmigs shing shes so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de la ni smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis dmigs shing shes so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: It is said that the concentration of the absence of expectancy observes and understands that.

original: ji ltar dmigs she na /
analyzed: ji ltar dmigs she na /
translated: How does it observe it?

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i sa bon gyi rten du gyur pa /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i sa bon gyi rten du gyur pa /
translated: The relative identity is the basis of the seeds of the afflictions and the obscurations to the knowable.
