original: skye ba dang rga ba la sogs pa sdug bsngal sna tshogs kyi rgyu yin pas smon par bya ba'i gnas ma yin no zhes de ltar dmigs so //🔽rgyal ba'i sras kyis sna tshogs pa'i //🔽byang chub phyogs ni thams cad dag / mthong ba'i lam dang lhan cig tu //
analyzed: skye ba dang rga ba la sogs pa sdug bsngal sna tshogs kyi rgyu yin pas smon par bya ba'i gnas ma yin no zhes de ltar dmigs so // rgyal ba'i sras kyis sna tshogs pa'i // byang chub phyogs ni thams cad dag / mthong ba'i lam dang lhan cig tu //
translated: Since birth, aging, and so on are the causes of various sufferings, they are not objects of aspiration.🔽The bodhisattva always obtains🔽all the various aspects of enlightenment

original: rtag tu thob par dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: rtag tu thob par dgongs pa'o //
translated: together with the path of seeing.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: This is the intention.

original: gang gi tshe sa dang po thob nas /
analyzed: gang gi tshe sa dang po thob nas /
translated: When one attains the first stage,

original: bzod pa brgyad dang ye shes brgyad de /
analyzed: bzod pa brgyad dang ye shes brgyad de /
translated: the eight forbearances and eight knowledges🔽are the sixteen moments that characterize the path of seeing.

original: mthong ba'i lam gyi mtshan nyid skad cig ma bcu drug skyes pas na de ltar lhan cig dus gcig dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun gyi chos rnam pa sna tshogs kyang dus gcig tu mthong bar dgongs te
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyi mtshan nyid skad cig ma bcu drug skyes pas na de ltar lhan cig dus gcig dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun gyi chos rnam pa sna tshogs kyang dus gcig tu mthong bar dgongs te
translated: Thus, together, at one time, the various aspects of the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment, such as the foundations of mindfulness, are seen.🔽This is the intention.

original: / dus gcig tu thob par shes bar bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: / dus gcig tu thob par shes bar bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: It should be understood that they are obtained at one time.

original: da 'di man chad tshigs su bcad pa lngas sa dang po mthong ba'i lam skyes pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bdag nyid chen po dang / ngo mtshar chen po ston te de bas na /🔽bdag med sdug bsngal skye ba tsam du yang //
analyzed: da 'di man chad tshigs su bcad pa lngas sa dang po mthong ba'i lam skyes pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bdag nyid chen po dang / ngo mtshar chen po ston te de bas na / bdag med sdug bsngal skye ba tsam du yang //
translated: Therefore,

original: 'gro ba 'dus byas tsam du blos chud nas //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /🔽'gro ba'i sgras ni khams gsum gyi chos thams cad la bya'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba 'dus byas tsam du blos chud nas // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / 'gro ba'i sgras ni khams gsum gyi chos thams cad la bya'o //
translated: With the wisdom that understands that the world is merely a collection of conditioned things,

original: 'dus byas tsam du blos chud ces bya bas ni sems dang / sems las byung pa tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: 'dus byas tsam du blos chud ces bya bas ni sems dang / sems las byung pa tsam du zad kyi /
translated: and that the self is merely a collection of aggregates,🔽the Bodhisattvas,

original: bdag ces bya ba med par shes rab kyis rtogs nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag ces bya ba med par shes rab kyis rtogs nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: who have realized that the self is merely a collection of aggregates,🔽and that the world is merely a collection of conditioned things,🔽are not frightened by the selflessness of the person and the selflessness of phenomena.

original: de ltar rtogs pa na khams gsum gyi chos thams cad gang zag gi dngos por yang bdag med chos kyi dngos por yang bdag med kyi /
analyzed: de ltar rtogs pa na khams gsum gyi chos thams cad gang zag gi dngos por yang bdag med chos kyi dngos por yang bdag med kyi /
translated: When they realize this, they understand that all the phenomena of the three realms are devoid of a self that is a person and devoid of a self that is a phenomenon.

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed ces bya ba nas /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed ces bya ba nas /
translated: They understand that the condition of ignorance gives rise to formation,🔽and so on.

original: skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi dang sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'ba' zhig 'byung bar 'gyur ro bar khong du chud do zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽don med rang bzhin @276a * //
analyzed: skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi dang sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'ba' zhig 'byung bar 'gyur ro bar khong du chud do zhes bya ba'i don to // don med rang bzhin @276a * //
translated: The meaning of the verse is that.

original: lta ba yongs spangs nas //🔽lta chen don po che la rten par byed //
analyzed: lta ba yongs spangs nas // lta chen don po che la rten par byed //
translated: Having completely abandoned the view of the useless nature,

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: he relies on the great meaning of the great view.

original: de ltar khong du chud ba na byang chub sems dpa' de don med pa'i rang bzhin gyi lta ba spangs pa zhes kyang bya /
analyzed: de ltar khong du chud ba na byang chub sems dpa' de don med pa'i rang bzhin gyi lta ba spangs pa zhes kyang bya /
translated: Thus, when he has understood in that way, the bodhisattva is said to have abandoned the view of the useless nature.

original: lta ba chen po la gnas pa zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: lta ba chen po la gnas pa zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: He is also said to abide in the great view.

original: de la sems can rnams ma rungs pa dang / rlag par byed pa'i lta ba la don med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la sems can rnams ma rungs pa dang / rlag par byed pa'i lta ba la don med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therein, the view that is harmful and destructive to sentient beings is called useless.

original: rang bzhin gyi sgras gzungs dang 'dzin pa la bya ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi sgras gzungs dang 'dzin pa la bya ste /
translated: The word nature refers to the subject and object.

original: lta ba'i gzung 'dzin gyi rgyu 'jig tshogs kyi lta ba la bya'o //
analyzed: lta ba'i gzung 'dzin gyi rgyu 'jig tshogs kyi lta ba la bya'o //
translated: The view of the subject and object of the perishable aggregates is the cause of the view.

original: sa dang po thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' 'jig tshogs su lta ba gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rgyur gyur pa 'gro ba rnams ma rungs par byed pa'i lta ba ngan pa spangs pas na don med pa'i rang bzhin gyi lta ba spangs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa dang po thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' 'jig tshogs su lta ba gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rgyur gyur pa 'gro ba rnams ma rungs par byed pa'i lta ba ngan pa spangs pas na don med pa'i rang bzhin gyi lta ba spangs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva who has attained the first ground is said to have abandoned the view that is by nature useless because he has abandoned the bad views that are the cause of the view of the transitory collection and of the subject and object, and that harm transmigrators.

original: sa dang po thob pa'i dus na bdag dang gzhan du mnyam pa nyid du shes pa'i lta ba thob pas na lta ba chen po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sa dang po thob pa'i dus na bdag dang gzhan du mnyam pa nyid du shes pa'i lta ba thob pas na lta ba chen po zhes bya ste /
translated: At the time of attaining the first ground, he obtains the view that knows the equality of self and others, and so it is called the great view.

original: de ltar mthong ba de nyid kyis mtha' yas pa'i sems can gyi don byed pas na lta ba chen po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar mthong ba de nyid kyis mtha' yas pa'i sems can gyi don byed pas na lta ba chen po zhes bya ste /
translated: Because that seeing itself benefits limitless sentient beings, it is called the great view.

original: de'i tshe na de lta bu'i lta ba la gnas pas na /
analyzed: de'i tshe na de lta bu'i lta ba la gnas pas na /
translated: At that time, by abiding in that kind of view,

original: lta ba chen po la gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: lta ba chen po la gnas pa yin te /
translated: he abides in the great view.

original: de yang 'jig rten na ngo mtshar du bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de yang 'jig rten na ngo mtshar du bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is also the meaning of the statement that it is a wonder in the world.

original: bdag lta med kyang gang de bdag tu lta //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bdag lta med kyang gang de bdag tu lta //🔽zhes bya ba la /
translated: Although there is no self, there is the view of self.

original: sa dang po thob pa'i dus na bdag tu lta ba zhes kyang bya /
analyzed: sa dang po thob pa'i dus na bdag tu lta ba zhes kyang bya /
translated: At the time of attaining the first ground, it is called the view of self.

original: bdag tu lta ba med pa zhes kyang bya'o//
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba med pa zhes kyang bya'o//
translated: It is also called the absence of the view of self.

original: ci'i phyir bdag tu lta ba med pa zhes kyang bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bdag tu lta ba med pa zhes kyang bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it called the absence of the view of self?

original: sa dang po thob pa'i dus na 'jig tshogs su lta ba spangs pa'i phyir bdag tu lta ba med pa zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: sa dang po thob pa'i dus na 'jig tshogs su lta ba spangs pa'i phyir bdag tu lta ba med pa zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: At the time of attaining the first ground, because the view of the transitory collection is abandoned, it is called the absence of the view of self.

original: ci'i phyir bdag tu lta ba zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bdag tu lta ba zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it called the view of self?

original: bdag gang yin pa de nyid sems can yang de yin no zhes bdag dang sems can du mnyam pa nyid du mthong bas na bdag tu lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gang yin pa de nyid sems can yang de yin no zhes bdag dang sems can du mnyam pa nyid du mthong bas na bdag tu lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it is seen that the self and sentient beings are the same, it is called the view of self.

original: sdug bsngal med kyang rab tu sdug bsngal zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal med kyang rab tu sdug bsngal zhes bya ba la /
translated: Although there is no suffering, it is called great suffering.

original: sa dang po thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de sdug bsngal med pa zhes kyang bya /
analyzed: sa dang po thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de sdug bsngal med pa zhes kyang bya /
translated: The bodhisattva who has attained the first ground is called one without suffering.

original: rab tu sdug bsngal ba zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: rab tu sdug bsngal ba zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: He is also called one with great suffering.

original: ci'i phyir sdug bsngal ba med pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sdug bsngal ba med pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is he called one without suffering?

original: bdag gi rgyud la yod pa'i sdug bsngal gsum dang brgyad la sogs pa spangs pas na sdug bsngal med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bdag gi rgyud la yod pa'i sdug bsngal gsum dang brgyad la sogs pa spangs pas na sdug bsngal med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Since it abandons the three sufferings and eight sufferings and so on that exist in one's mindstream, it is called the absence of suffering.

original: de'i phyir sa bcu'i sa dang po'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: de'i phyir sa bcu'i sa dang po'i mdo las kyang /
translated: Therefore the sutra on the levels declares:

original: sa dang po la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni 'jigs pa lnga las 'das pa yin no zhes bshad do //🔽'jigs pa lnga ni /
analyzed: sa dang po la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni 'jigs pa lnga las 'das pa yin no zhes bshad do // 'jigs pa lnga ni /
translated: Bodhisattvas who have entered the first level have transcended the five fears.

original: 'tsho ba med pa'i 'jigs pa dang / @276b tshigs bcad med pa'i 'jigs ba dang / 'khor gyi 'jigs pa dang / ngan song du skye ba'i 'jigs pa dang / 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa ste de lnga las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: 'tsho ba med pa'i 'jigs pa dang / @276b tshigs bcad med pa'i 'jigs ba dang / 'khor gyi 'jigs pa dang / ngan song du skye ba'i 'jigs pa dang / 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa ste de lnga las 'das pa'o //
translated: The five fears are the fear of having no livelihood, the fear of not being praised, the fear of being in a crowd, the fear of lower rebirth and the fear of death.

original: de lta mod kyi byang chub sems dpa' sems can mtha' yas pa'i sdug bsngal spangs dgos te /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi byang chub sems dpa' sems can mtha' yas pa'i sdug bsngal spangs dgos te /
translated: But bodhisattvas must abandon the sufferings of infinite sentient beings.

original: sems can gyi sdug bsngal ma spangs kyi bar du snying rje'i dbang gis sems can sdug bsngal bas bdag sdug bsngal bar gyur pas na rab tu sdug bsngal ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi sdug bsngal ma spangs kyi bar du snying rje'i dbang gis sems can sdug bsngal bas bdag sdug bsngal bar gyur pas na rab tu sdug bsngal ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Until the suffering of sentient beings is eliminated, because of the power of compassion, the bodhisattva suffers because sentient beings suffer. Therefore, he is called “one who suffers greatly.”

original: ji ltar bdag la bdag gis phan byed bzhin //
analyzed: ji ltar bdag la bdag gis phan byed bzhin //
translated: Like one who benefits oneself,

original: thams cad don byas lan ni re ba med //
analyzed: thams cad don byas lan ni re ba med //
translated: he benefits all without expecting anything in return.

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: Here is the explanation.

original: sa dang po thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de phan par byed pa zhes kyang bya /
analyzed: sa dang po thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de phan par byed pa zhes kyang bya /
translated: The bodhisattva who has attained the first stage is called “one who benefits”

original: phan par mi byed pa zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: phan par mi byed pa zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: and also “one who does not benefit.”

original: ji ltar phan par byed pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar phan par byed pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: How is he one who benefits?

original: sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba'i don sgrub par byed pas phan par byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba'i don sgrub par byed pas phan par byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He is called “one who benefits” because he accomplishes the benefit and happiness of all sentient beings.

original: 'on kyang phan par mi byed ba zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang phan par mi byed ba zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: However, he is also called “one who does not benefit.”

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: ji ltar bdag la phan btags te //
analyzed: ji ltar bdag la phan btags te //
translated: Like one who benefits oneself,

original: lan re ba med pa ltar sems can thams cad la phan btags na yang bdag gis sems can thams cad la phan btags te /
analyzed: lan re ba med pa ltar sems can thams cad la phan btags na yang bdag gis sems can thams cad la phan btags te /
translated: And even though he benefits all sentient beings, he does not think, “I have benefited all sentient beings.

original: legs par byas so zhes mi dgongs shing phan btags pa'i lan la re ba med pas na phan par mi byed pa zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: legs par byas so zhes mi dgongs shing phan btags pa'i lan la re ba med pas na phan par mi byed pa zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: I have done well!” He does not expect any reward for his help. Therefore, he is called “the one who does not benefit.”

original: de bas na 'phags pa rdo rje gcod pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: de bas na 'phags pa rdo rje gcod pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: Thus, the noble Diamond-Cutter Sūtra also says,

original: sems can thams cad phung po'i lhag ma ma lus ba las kyang mya ngan las 'das par yongs su mya ngan las 'das kyang sems can gang yang yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa med do zhes sems bskyed par bya'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad phung po'i lhag ma ma lus ba las kyang mya ngan las 'das par yongs su mya ngan las 'das kyang sems can gang yang yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa med do zhes sems bskyed par bya'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: “Even if all sentient beings were to say, ‘I will fully pass beyond sorrow without remainder of the aggregates of all sentient beings,’ no sentient being at all would fully pass beyond sorrow.”

original: mchog gi grol bas rang sems grol ba yang //
analyzed: mchog gi grol bas rang sems grol ba yang //
translated: The supreme liberation is the liberation of one’s own mind,

original: yun ring dam po'i bcing bas bcings pa'o //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yun ring dam po'i bcing bas bcings pa'o // zhes bya ba la /
translated: which is bound for a long time by the tight bonds of the highest.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de mchog gi grol bas grol ba zhes kyang bya /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de mchog gi grol bas grol ba zhes kyang bya /
translated: Here, the bodhisattva is called “the one who is liberated by the supreme liberation.”

original: yun ring po'i bcing bas bcings pa zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: yun ring po'i bcing bas bcings pa zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: It is also called “bound by a long bondage.”

original: ji ltar na mchog gi grol bas grol ba zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na mchog gi grol bas grol ba zhes bya zhe na /
translated: How is it called “liberated by the highest liberation”?

original: bdag gi rgyud la yod pa'i mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pas na mchog gi grol bas grol ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gi rgyud la yod pa'i mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pas na mchog gi grol bas grol ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called “liberated by the highest liberation” because it abandons the afflictions that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing that exist in one’s own continuum.

original: ji ltar yun ring po'i bcings bas bcings ba zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar yun ring po'i bcings bas bcings ba zhes bya zhe na /
translated: How is it called “bound by a long bondage”?

original: byang chub sems dpa' des sems can mtha' yas pa'i sems kyi rgyud la yod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i bcing ba bcad dgos te /🔽sems can gyi nyon mongs pa'i bcing bam @277a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' des sems can mtha' yas pa'i sems kyi rgyud la yod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i bcing ba bcad dgos te / sems can gyi nyon mongs pa'i bcing bam @277a * //
translated: That bodhisattva must sever the bondage of the afflictions that exist in the continua of infinite sentient beings.🔽As long as the bondage of the afflictions of sentient beings is not severed, the bodhisattva does not attain manifest complete buddhahood and remains in cyclic existence.

original: bcad kyi bar du byang chub sems dpa' mngon par 'chad mi rgya zhing 'khor ba'i mthar yang 'khor ba na gnas par byed pa na bcing ba dam pos bcings ba zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: bcad kyi bar du byang chub sems dpa' mngon par 'chad mi rgya zhing 'khor ba'i mthar yang 'khor ba na gnas par byed pa na bcing ba dam pos bcings ba zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: It is also called “bound by a firm bondage.”

original: sdug bsngal mtha' ni ma mthong yang //
analyzed: sdug bsngal mtha' ni ma mthong yang //
translated: Although the end of suffering is not seen,

original: de bzhin rab 'jug de bzhin byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin rab 'jug de bzhin byed pa'o //
translated: one engages in that way and acts in that way.

original: zhes bya ba la /🔽sa dang po thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de sdug bsngal gyi mthar byed pa zhes kyang bya /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la / sa dang po thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de sdug bsngal gyi mthar byed pa zhes kyang bya /
translated: As this says,🔽the bodhisattva who has attained the first ground is also called “one who has reached the end of suffering.”🔽🔽

original: mthar mi byed pa zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: mthar mi byed pa zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: 1. The Bodhisattva who has attained the first stage is called “he who makes an end of suffering” and “he who does not make an end of suffering.”

original: ji ltar na sdug bsngal gyi mthar byed pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na sdug bsngal gyi mthar byed pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: How is it that he makes an end of suffering?

original: bdag gi rgyud la yod pa'i sdug bsngal thams cad zad par byed pas na sdug bsngal gyi mthar byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gi rgyud la yod pa'i sdug bsngal thams cad zad par byed pas na sdug bsngal gyi mthar byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He makes an end of all the suffering that exists in his own life-stream.

original: ji ltar na sdug bsngal gyi mthar mi byed pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na sdug bsngal gyi mthar mi byed pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: How is it that he does not make an end of suffering?

original: nam mkha' mtha' thug pa med pa bzhin du sems can yang mtha' thug pa med do //
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' thug pa med pa bzhin du sems can yang mtha' thug pa med do //
translated: Just as space is without limit, so also are living beings without limit.

original: sems can mtha' thug pa med pa bzhin du sdug bsngal yang mtha' thug par ma mthong ste /
analyzed: sems can mtha' thug pa med pa bzhin du sdug bsngal yang mtha' thug par ma mthong ste /
translated: Just as living beings are without limit, so also is suffering seen to be without limit.

original: ji ltar byas kyang sdug bsngal gyi mtha' zad par mi 'gyur bar mthong bas na mthar mi byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar byas kyang sdug bsngal gyi mtha' zad par mi 'gyur bar mthong bas na mthar mi byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: However much he might try, he sees that he cannot bring suffering to an end.

original: de ltar sdug bsngal gyi mtha' med med kyi /
analyzed: de ltar sdug bsngal gyi mtha' med med kyi /
translated: Thus, he does not make an end of suffering.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems can yal bar 'dor shing sems can gyi sdug bsngal mi sel ba ma yin gyi /🔽sems can gyi sdug bsngal bsal bar bya ba'i phyir de bzhin du 'khor bar yang 'jug cing sdug bsngal bsal bar bya ba'i don du sems can yang pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i chos la 'jog / bdag nyid kyang pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems can yal bar 'dor shing sems can gyi sdug bsngal mi sel ba ma yin gyi / sems can gyi sdug bsngal bsal bar bya ba'i phyir de bzhin du 'khor bar yang 'jug cing sdug bsngal bsal bar bya ba'i don du sems can yang pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i chos la 'jog / bdag nyid kyang pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs
translated: Bodhisattvas do not abandon sentient beings and do not remove the suffering of sentient beings.

original: pa'i chos byed do //
analyzed: pa'i chos byed do //
translated: For the sake of removing the suffering of sentient beings, they enter cyclic existence in that way. For the sake of removing suffering, they establish sentient beings in the Dharma of the perfections and so forth. They themselves practice the Dharma of the perfections and so forth.

original: tshe gcig rang gi sdug bsngal bzod mthu med //
analyzed: tshe gcig rang gi sdug bsngal bzod mthu med //
translated: They have no power to endure their own suffering for one lifetime.

original: 'jig rten yod kyi bar du gzhan sdug bsngal //
analyzed: 'jig rten yod kyi bar du gzhan sdug bsngal //
translated: For as long as the world exists, they endure the suffering of others.

original: bsdus la bsam pa smas ci dgos //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bsdus la bsam pa smas ci dgos // zhes bya ba la /
translated: What need is there to mention the suffering of beings in hell?🔽In the phrase “for as long as the world exists,”

original: rang gi sdug bsngal zhes bya ba dang / bsdus pa zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: rang gi sdug bsngal zhes bya ba dang / bsdus pa zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: the word “world” refers to sentient beings.

original: 'jig rten pa rnams ni rang gi don du rang gi sdug bsngal nyid la nyams su len cing bzod pa'i mthu med pa ni sems can gzhan gyi sdug bsngal bsdus pa dpag tu med pa nyams su len cing bzod pa lta ga la nus so zhes bya ba'i🔽don to // 'jig rten pa rnams ni rang gi don du tshe gcig gi rang gi lus sdug bsngal tsam yang nyams su len pa'i bzod pa'i mthu med na sems can gyi don du 'khor ba thog ma med pa nas tha ma med pa'i bar du sems can thams cad kyi
analyzed: 'jig rten pa rnams ni rang gi don du rang gi sdug bsngal nyid la nyams su len cing bzod pa'i mthu med pa ni sems can gzhan gyi sdug bsngal bsdus pa dpag tu med pa nyams su len cing bzod pa lta ga la nus so zhes bya ba'i don to // 'jig rten pa rnams ni rang gi don du tshe gcig gi rang gi lus sdug bsngal tsam yang nyams su len pa'i bzod pa'i mthu med na sems can gyi don du 'khor ba thog ma med pa nas tha ma med pa'i bar du sems can thams cad kyi
translated: How could worldly people, who have no power to endure even their own suffering for their own sake, have the power to endure the immeasurable suffering of other sentient beings that is gathered into their own suffering?🔽This is the meaning.

original: sdug bsngal nyams su blang zhing bzod pa bya ba lta ga la @277b sems te mi sems so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sdug bsngal nyams su blang zhing bzod pa bya ba lta ga la @277b sems te mi sems so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If worldly people have no power to endure even the suffering of their own body for one lifetime for their own sake, how could they have the thought to endure and take on the suffering of all sentient beings from beginningless cyclic existence until the end, for the sake of sentient beings?🔽This is the meaning.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de las bzlog pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de las bzlog pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Bodhisattvas are the opposite of that.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni 'jig rten pa las bzlog pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni 'jig rten pa las bzlog pa ste /
translated: Bodhisattvas are the opposite of worldly people.

original: bdag gi don du bdag gi sdug bsngal nyams su mi len gyi sems can gyi don du sems can gyi sdug bsngal dpag tu med pa nyams su len cing bzod pa'i mthu yod pa dang / 'khor ba'i mtha'i bar du sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal nyams su len par sems so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag gi don du bdag gi sdug bsngal nyams su mi len gyi sems can gyi don du sems can gyi sdug bsngal dpag tu med pa nyams su len cing bzod pa'i mthu yod pa dang / 'khor ba'i mtha'i bar du sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal nyams su len par sems so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: For the sake of others, I will take on the immeasurable suffering of sentient beings, and I will have the power of patience. I will take on the suffering of all sentient beings until the end of cyclic existence.

original: gang mdza' gang phan 'dod pa'i sbyor ba dang // rgyal ba'i sras kyis sems can mi skyo ba //
analyzed: gang mdza' gang phan 'dod pa'i sbyor ba dang // rgyal ba'i sras kyis sems can mi skyo ba //
translated: The application of those who desire what is dear and beneficial,🔽and the bodhisattvas' indefatigability with regard to sentient beings,

original: de dag 'jig rten dag na ngo mtshar che //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de dag 'jig rten dag na ngo mtshar che //🔽zhes bya ba la /
translated: are the most amazing things in the world.

original: dper na ba be'u la byams pas be'u la phan pa dang bde ba sbyor pa skyo ba med pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang sems can thams cad la mdza' ba dang / dga' ba dang byams pa'i sems dang / phan pa dang bde ba la sbyor zhing zhugs pas na sems can rnams kyis gnod par byas kyang sems can gyis mi skyo zhing sems can mi gtong ste /
analyzed: dper na ba be'u la byams pas be'u la phan pa dang bde ba sbyor pa skyo ba med pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang sems can thams cad la mdza' ba dang / dga' ba dang byams pa'i sems dang / phan pa dang bde ba la sbyor zhing zhugs pas na sems can rnams kyis gnod par byas kyang sems can gyis mi skyo zhing sems can mi gtong ste /
translated: Just as a cow is not discouraged in giving milk to her calf, and so is not discouraged in providing for the calf's welfare and happiness, in the same way, the bodhisattva is not discouraged by sentient beings' ingratitude, and so is not discouraged in providing for sentient beings' welfare and happiness.

original: de bas na don med pa'i lta ba gnas pa nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de bas na don med pa'i lta ba gnas pa nas brtsams te /
translated: Therefore, beginning with the useless views,

original: mi skyo ba'i bar dag 'di dag ni 'jig rten na byang chub sems dpa'i mdzad pa la ngo mtshar du bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽sems can bdag mtshungs thob pas de la ni //
analyzed: mi skyo ba'i bar dag 'di dag ni 'jig rten na byang chub sems dpa'i mdzad pa la ngo mtshar du bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to // sems can bdag mtshungs thob pas de la ni //
translated: up to not being discouraged, these are the things that are considered in the world to be the bodhisattva's amazing deeds.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: The bodhisattva is not discouraged in providing for sentient beings' welfare and happiness, because he has attained the same identity as sentient beings.

original: 'dis ni ngo mtshar mi che ba bstan te /
analyzed: 'dis ni ngo mtshar mi che ba bstan te /
translated: This shows that it is not amazing.

original: gang la bdag dang gzhan du mnyam pa nyid kyi sems ma thob pa de dag la gong du bshad pa lta bu dag byung na ngo mtshar du bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gang la bdag dang gzhan du mnyam pa nyid kyi sems ma thob pa de dag la gong du bshad pa lta bu dag byung na ngo mtshar du bya ba yin no //
translated: For those who have not attained the thought of sameness with regard to self and others, it is indeed amazing if the above mentioned things occur.

original: dper na bdag la phan 'dogs shing bde ba la sbyor bar byed pa la ngo mtshar du mi che ba de bzhin du 'dir yang byang chub sems dpas bdag dang sems can du mnyam pa nyid kyi sems thob ste /
analyzed: dper na bdag la phan 'dogs shing bde ba la sbyor bar byed pa la ngo mtshar du mi che ba de bzhin du 'dir yang byang chub sems dpas bdag dang sems can du mnyam pa nyid kyi sems thob ste /
translated: Just as it is not very amazing to help and bring happiness to oneself, in the same way, when the bodhisattva has attained the thought of sameness with regard to self and sentient beings,

original: sems can thams cad bdag nyid yin par khong du chud de sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba byed cing re ba lta ci zhig ngo mtshar du che ste ngo mtshar du mi che'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems can thams cad bdag nyid yin par khong du chud de sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba byed cing re ba lta ci zhig ngo mtshar du che ste ngo mtshar du mi che'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: it is not very amazing that he should bring about the welfare and happiness of all sentient beings, since he has understood that all sentient beings are himself.

original: byang chub sems dpa' che ba'i bdag nyid che ba brjod da zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' che ba'i bdag nyid che ba brjod da zhes bya ba la /
translated: The greatness of the bodhisattva is described.

original: sa dang po thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan dang phrin las su mdzad pa la ngo mtshar chen por bya ba'i chos bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sa dang po thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan dang phrin las su mdzad pa la ngo mtshar chen por bya ba'i chos bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the above is that the qualities and deeds of the bodhisattva who has attained the first stage are taught to be the phenomena of great wonder.

original: gang nyon mongs pa'i bdag tu lta ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gang nyon mongs pa'i bdag tu lta ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: As for the statement, “The view of self that is an affliction,”

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad 'byung @278a * //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad 'byung @278a * //
translated: the view of the transitory collection is the cause that gives rise to all the afflictions, such as desire.

original: bar byed pa'i rgyu 'jig tshogs kyi lta ba la don med pa'i rang bzhin gyi lta ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bar byed pa'i rgyu 'jig tshogs kyi lta ba la don med pa'i rang bzhin gyi lta ba zhes bya ste /
translated: It is called the view of a useless nature.

original: ci'i phyir don med pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir don med pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it called useless?

original: 'jig tshogs su lta ba dang khams gsum dang ngan song du skye ba'i rgyu byed pa'i byang chub thob par bya ba bar du gcod pas na don med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs su lta ba dang khams gsum dang ngan song du skye ba'i rgyu byed pa'i byang chub thob par bya ba bar du gcod pas na don med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because the view of the transitory collection is the cause of rebirth in the three realms and the lower realms, it is called useless because it obstructs the attainment of enlightenment.

original: lta ba chen po'i don chen po ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la lta ba chen po je bshad de /
analyzed: lta ba chen po'i don chen po ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la lta ba chen po je bshad de /
translated: As for the statement, “The great view is the great meaning,” the great view is explained as follows.

original: bdag gang yin pa sems can thams cad kyang de yin sems can thams cad gang yin pa bdag kyang de yin no zhes sems can dang bdag tu dbyer med cing mnyam pa nyid du lta ba ni lta ba chen po don chen po la gnas pa zhes bya'o
analyzed: bdag gang yin pa sems can thams cad kyang de yin sems can thams cad gang yin pa bdag kyang de yin no zhes sems can dang bdag tu dbyer med cing mnyam pa nyid du lta ba ni lta ba chen po don chen po la gnas pa zhes bya'o
translated: The view that the self is the same as all sentient beings and all sentient beings are the same as the self is called the great view, the view of the great meaning.

original: // ji ltar lta ba la ni ci'i phyir don chen po zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: // ji ltar lta ba la ni ci'i phyir don chen po zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it called the great meaning?

original: de'i phyir sems can thams cad kyi don bya ba'i rgyu'i phyir don chen po'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sems can thams cad kyi don bya ba'i rgyu'i phyir don chen po'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is called the great meaning because it is the cause for accomplishing the aims of all sentient beings.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi lta ba ni sems can thams cad kyi don byed pa'i rgyu mi byed pas na don chen po ma yin gyi /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi lta ba ni sems can thams cad kyi don byed pa'i rgyu mi byed pas na don chen po ma yin gyi /
translated: The views of the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas are not the great meaning because they do not act as the cause for accomplishing the aims of all sentient beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa' bdag dang gzhan du mnyam pa nyid du lta ba ni sems can thams cad la phan pa dang / bde ba byed pa'i rgyu byed pas na don chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bdag dang gzhan du mnyam pa nyid du lta ba ni sems can thams cad la phan pa dang / bde ba byed pa'i rgyu byed pas na don chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattvas view of the sameness of self and others is called the great meaning because it acts as the cause for accomplishing the welfare and happiness of all sentient beings.

original: bdag tu lta ba med pa ni don med pa'i rang bzhin gyi'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba med pa ni don med pa'i rang bzhin gyi'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The absence of the view of self is the cause of meaninglessness.

original: don med par 'gyur ba'i rgyu 'jig tshogs su lta ba sngangs pas na bdag tu lta ba med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don med par 'gyur ba'i rgyu 'jig tshogs su lta ba sngangs pas na bdag tu lta ba med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The view of the perishable constituents is the cause of meaninglessness, since it is the cause of the absence of the view of self.

original: bdag tu lta ba ni don chen po'o zhes bya ba la /🔽bdag dang sems can du mnyam par lta ste /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba ni don chen po'o zhes bya ba la / bdag dang sems can du mnyam par lta ste /
translated: The view of self is the cause of the great meaning.🔽The view of the equality of self and sentient beings is the view of the great meaning.

original: sems de nyid bdag yin no zhes don chen po'i lta ba la gnas pas na bdag tu lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems de nyid bdag yin no zhes don chen po'i lta ba la gnas pas na bdag tu lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The view of self is the view of the great meaning, since it is the view of the equality of self and sentient beings.

original: sdug bsngal med pa ni bdag gi rgyud las skyes pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal med pa ni bdag gi rgyud las skyes pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The absence of suffering is that which arises from the continuum of self.

original: sa dang po la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de sdug bsngal med pa zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: sa dang po la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de sdug bsngal med pa zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: The Bodhisattva who has entered the first stage is called the absence of suffering.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bdag gi rgyud la yod pa'i sdug bsngal gsum dang brgyad la sogs pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag gi rgyud la yod pa'i sdug bsngal gsum dang brgyad la sogs pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he has abandoned the three sufferings, the eight sufferings, and so on, which exist in the continuum of self.

original: sems can thams cad kyi rgyud las skyes pa ni rab tu sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi rgyud las skyes pa ni rab tu sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The suffering that arises from the mindstreams of all sentient beings is the suffering of others.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de rab tu sdug bsngal zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de rab tu sdug bsngal zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: The bodhisattva is called one who has great suffering.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal bsal dgos la sems can sdug bsngal bar mthong na snying rje'i dbang gis byang chub sems dpa' nyid sems gdung zhing sdug bsngal bar 'gyur bas na @278b rab tu sdug bsngal ba zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal bsal dgos la sems can sdug bsngal bar mthong na snying rje'i dbang gis byang chub sems dpa' nyid sems gdung zhing sdug bsngal bar 'gyur bas na @278b rab tu sdug bsngal ba zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva must eliminate the suffering of all sentient beings and when he sees sentient beings suffering, his mind is tormented and he suffers through the power of compassion, so he is called one who has great suffering.

original: sems grol ba ni mthong ba'i lam gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sems grol ba ni mthong ba'i lam gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The bodhisattva is called one whose mind is liberated through seeing the truth of the path of seeing and so on.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de sems grol ba zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de sems grol ba zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: The bodhisattva is called one whose mind is liberated.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: bdag gi rgyud la yod pa'i mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pas bcings pa rnams mthong ba'i lam gyis spangs pas na grol ba mchog gis grol ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gi rgyud la yod pa'i mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pas bcings pa rnams mthong ba'i lam gyis spangs pas na grol ba mchog gis grol ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The afflictions to be abandoned by the path of seeing that exist in one’s mindstream are abandoned by the path of seeing, and therefore it is called “liberated by supreme liberation.”

original: grol ba mchog gis ni bla na med pa'i theg pas so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: grol ba mchog gis ni bla na med pa'i theg pas so zhes bya ba la /
translated: Liberated by the supreme vehicle means

original: grol ba de yang theg ba chung du'i mthong ba'i lam gang zag la bdag med pas grol ba ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: grol ba de yang theg ba chung du'i mthong ba'i lam gang zag la bdag med pas grol ba ni ma yin gyi /
translated: that liberation is not by the path of seeing of the Hinayana, which is liberated by the selflessness of persons.

original: theg pa chen po'i lam mthong ba'i lam gang zag dang chos la bdag med par rtogs pas grol bas na grol ba'i mchog ces bya'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i lam mthong ba'i lam gang zag dang chos la bdag med par rtogs pas grol bas na grol ba'i mchog ces bya'o //
translated: It is called “supreme liberation” because it is liberated by the path of seeing of the Mahayana, which realizes the selflessness of persons and phenomena.

original: yun ring por dam du bcings pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: yun ring por dam du bcings pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: For a long time, bound by tight bonds,

original: byang chub sems dpa' de yun ring por 'ching ba dam pos bcings pa zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de yun ring por 'ching ba dam pos bcings pa zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: means that bodhisattvas are said to be “bound for a long time by tight bonds.”

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sems can rnams ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / 'dod pa'i yon tan la chags pa'i bcing bas bcings te /
analyzed: sems can rnams ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / 'dod pa'i yon tan la chags pa'i bcing bas bcings te /
translated: Sentient beings are bound by the bonds of the afflictions such as desire and attachment to the qualities of desire.

original: sems can rnams bcings pa de las ma grol ma thar gyi bar du byang chub sems dpa' bdag nyid grol ba dang / thar bar mi byed de rtag tu khams gsum du gnas pas na /
analyzed: sems can rnams bcings pa de las ma grol ma thar gyi bar du byang chub sems dpa' bdag nyid grol ba dang / thar bar mi byed de rtag tu khams gsum du gnas pas na /
translated: Until those sentient beings are liberated from that bondage, the bodhisattva does not liberate himself or become liberated, always remaining in the three realms.

original: yun ring por dam du bcing bas bcings zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yun ring por dam du bcing bas bcings zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said that he is bound by long-lasting, tight bonds.

original: de la grol ba'i mchog gis grol zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la grol ba'i mchog gis grol zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Liberated by the highest liberation is explained as follows.

original: 'khor ba na mi gnas pa bstan /
analyzed: 'khor ba na mi gnas pa bstan /
translated: It shows that he does not remain in samsara.

original: yun ring por dam du bcing bas bcings zhes bya ba ni /🔽mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas pa bstan te /
analyzed: yun ring por dam du bcing bas bcings zhes bya ba ni / mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas pa bstan te /
translated: It is said that he is bound by long-lasting, tight bonds.🔽It shows that he does not remain in nirvana.

original: don du mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: don du mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: It shows that he does not remain in the ultimate nirvana.

original: nam mkha' dang 'dra bar sems can gyi khams zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: nam mkha' dang 'dra bar sems can gyi khams zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The realm of sentient beings is like space.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de sdug bsngal gyi mthar mi byed pa zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de sdug bsngal gyi mthar mi byed pa zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: The bodhisattva is also called one who does not make an end of suffering.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: ji ltar nam mkha'i khams mtha' med pa de bzhin du sems can gyi khams kyang mtha' med do //
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha'i khams mtha' med pa de bzhin du sems can gyi khams kyang mtha' med do //
translated: Just as the realm of space is endless, so too is the realm of sentient beings endless.

original: sems can gyi khams mtha' med pa de bzhin du sdug bsngal yang mtha' med par mthong ste /
analyzed: sems can gyi khams mtha' med pa de bzhin du sdug bsngal yang mtha' med par mthong ste /
translated: Just as the realm of sentient beings is endless, so too is suffering seen to be endless.

original: nam yang sems can gyi sdug bsngal mthar byed par mi 'gyur bas na ba sdug bsngal gyi mthar mi byed pa zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: nam yang sems can gyi sdug bsngal mthar byed par mi 'gyur bas na ba sdug bsngal gyi mthar mi byed pa zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: Since the suffering of sentient beings is never brought to an end, he is also called one who does not make an end of suffering.

original: 'jug pa'i sems can gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /🔽de ltar sdug bsngal gyi mtha' mi mthong yang sems can rnams kyi sdug bsngal @279a * //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i sems can gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / de ltar sdug bsngal gyi mtha' mi mthong yang sems can rnams kyi sdug bsngal @279a * //
translated: With regard to the phrase “engaging with sentient beings,” etc.

original: mthar mi 'byin pa yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: mthar mi 'byin pa yin nam zhe na /
translated: Even though he does not see an end to suffering, does he not put an end to the suffering of sentient beings?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, he does not.

original: sems can rnams kyi sdug bsngal mthar dbyung bar bya ba'i phyir 'khor bar yang 'jug go zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi sdug bsngal mthar dbyung bar bya ba'i phyir 'khor bar yang 'jug go zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he engages in cyclic existence in order to put an end to the suffering of sentient beings.

original: de bzhin byed pa ni sems can rnams kyi mtha' med pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de bzhin byed pa ni sems can rnams kyi mtha' med pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Likewise, the activity is the infinitude of sentient beings.

original: sems can ni nam mkha' bzhin du mtha' med de /
analyzed: sems can ni nam mkha' bzhin du mtha' med de /
translated: Sentient beings are infinite like space.

original: sems can mtha' med pa bzhin du sems can gyi sdug bsngal mthar dbyung bar bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems can gyi don la yang mtha' med par sbyor zhing byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems can mtha' med pa bzhin du sems can gyi sdug bsngal mthar dbyung bar bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems can gyi don la yang mtha' med par sbyor zhing byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Since sentient beings are infinite, in order to remove the suffering of sentient beings to the end, the bodhisattva applies himself to the welfare of sentient beings to the end, and acts. This is the meaning.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de las bzlog pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de las bzlog pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The bodhisattva is the opposite of that.

original: 'jig rten pa rnams ni tshe gcig tsam gyi sdug bsngal dang / rang gi sdug bsngal yang nyams su len cing bzod pa'i mthu med na 'khor ba'i mtha'i bar gyi sdug bsngal dang / sems can dpag tu med pa'i sdug bsngal nyams su len pa lta ga la nus te mi nus so //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa rnams ni tshe gcig tsam gyi sdug bsngal dang / rang gi sdug bsngal yang nyams su len cing bzod pa'i mthu med na 'khor ba'i mtha'i bar gyi sdug bsngal dang / sems can dpag tu med pa'i sdug bsngal nyams su len pa lta ga la nus te mi nus so //
translated: Worldly people do not have the power to endure and take on even the suffering of one lifetime, or their own suffering. How could they possibly take on the suffering of sentient beings to the end of cyclic existence, and the suffering of infinite sentient beings? They cannot.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni de las bzlog pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni de las bzlog pa ste /
translated: The bodhisattva is the opposite of that.

original: ji ltar bzlog ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar bzlog ce na /
translated: How is he the opposite?

original: sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal gyi phung po nyams su len cing bzod pa dang / 'khor ba ji srid yod kyi bar du sems can gyi don las byung ba'i sdug bsngal nyams su len cing bzod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal gyi phung po nyams su len cing bzod pa dang / 'khor ba ji srid yod kyi bar du sems can gyi don las byung ba'i sdug bsngal nyams su len cing bzod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means that they accept and endure the mass of suffering of all sentient beings, and they accept and endure the suffering that arises from working for the welfare of sentient beings for as long as cyclic existence exists.

original: gang sems can byang chub sems dpa' dga' ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gang sems can byang chub sems dpa' dga' ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: As for the passage beginning “The bodhisattvas’ joy in sentient beings,”

original: dper na ba be'u la byams pa dang / phan par sbyor ba la skyo ba med pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems can la dga' ba dang / phan par 'dod pa dang / de'i don la sbyor ba'i tshul gyis rnam pa gsum lta bur sems can gyi don la zhugs pa na sems can gyis gnod pa byas na yang mi skyo ste /
analyzed: dper na ba be'u la byams pa dang / phan par sbyor ba la skyo ba med pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems can la dga' ba dang / phan par 'dod pa dang / de'i don la sbyor ba'i tshul gyis rnam pa gsum lta bur sems can gyi don la zhugs pa na sems can gyis gnod pa byas na yang mi skyo ste /
translated: just as a mother’s love for her child and her application to her child’s welfare are never discouraged, in the same way, when bodhisattvas are engaged in working for the welfare of sentient beings through the three aspects of joy in sentient beings, wishing to benefit them, and applying themselves to their welfare, they are not discouraged even when sentient beings harm them.

original: gong du bshad pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i phrin las 'di dag ni 'jig rten na ngo mtshar mchog tu bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gong du bshad pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i phrin las 'di dag ni 'jig rten na ngo mtshar mchog tu bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The bodhisattva's activities explained above are the most marvelous in the world.

original: de la sems can dang bral bar mi 'dod pa'i byams pa'i sems la dga' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la sems can dang bral bar mi 'dod pa'i byams pa'i sems la dga' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Of these, the mind of love that does not wish to abandon sentient beings is called delight.

original: sems can gyi mi bde ba sel bar byed pa ni phan par 'dod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi mi bde ba sel bar byed pa ni phan par 'dod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The removal of sentient beings' suffering is called the wish to help.

original: sems can sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa spyod du bcug pa ni don la sbyar ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa spyod du bcug pa ni don la sbyar ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The engagement of sentient beings in the perfections such as generosity is called engagement in the aim.

original: ngo mtshar che ba ma yin pa ni sems can dang bdag tu mtshungs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ngo mtshar che ba ma yin pa ni sems can dang bdag tu mtshungs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is not marvelous because sentient beings are the same as oneself.

original: de lta mod kyi 'on kyang ngo mtshar che bar yang bzhag ste /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi 'on kyang ngo mtshar che bar yang bzhag ste /
translated: But still, it is established as marvelous.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: dper na bdag la bdag phan par byed pa dang / @279b bdag gi don bdag byed pa ngo mtshar mi che ba bzhin du sa dang po thob pa'i byang chub sems dpas kyang bdag dang sems can du mnyam pa'i sems thob ste /
analyzed: dper na bdag la bdag phan par byed pa dang / @279b bdag gi don bdag byed pa ngo mtshar mi che ba bzhin du sa dang po thob pa'i byang chub sems dpas kyang bdag dang sems can du mnyam pa'i sems thob ste /
translated: Just as it is not surprising that one should benefit oneself and do one's own work, in the same way, when the bodhisattva has attained the first stage, he has attained the thought of sameness with regard to himself and all beings.

original: sems can thams cad bdag nyid yin par khong du chud pa des sems can la phan 'dogs pa ci zhig ngo mtshar che ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad bdag nyid yin par khong du chud pa des sems can la phan 'dogs pa ci zhig ngo mtshar che ste /
translated: What is there to be surprised at in his benefiting beings, since he has understood that all beings are himself?

original: bdag la bdag phan 'dogs pa ngo mtshar mi che ba dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag la bdag phan 'dogs pa ngo mtshar mi che ba dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not surprising that he should benefit himself.

original: de ltar mthong ba'i lam bshad nas //
analyzed: de ltar mthong ba'i lam bshad nas //
translated: Having explained the path of insight in this way,

original: da ni bsgom pa'i lam bshad de //
analyzed: da ni bsgom pa'i lam bshad de //
translated: now the path of cultivation is explained.

original: de'i phyir de nas lhag ma'i sa la ste //
analyzed: de'i phyir de nas lhag ma'i sa la ste //
translated: Therefore, then, on the remaining stages,🔽on the remaining stages, the bodhisattva

original: des ni bsgom pa'i lam dag la //🔽ye shes rnam pa 'di gnyis kyis //🔽bsgom pa'i phyir na rab 'jug go //
analyzed: des ni bsgom pa'i lam dag la // ye shes rnam pa 'di gnyis kyis // bsgom pa'i phyir na rab 'jug go //
translated: enters into the cultivation🔽of the two kinds of intuition.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The two kinds of intuition are the nonimaginative and the subsequently attained.

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni sa dang po thob pa'i lam thob nas de'i 'og tu zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni sa dang po thob pa'i lam thob nas de'i 'og tu zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Then refers to the path of the first stage, having attained it, subsequently.

original: lhag ma'i sa ni sa gnyis yan chad sa bcu man chad la bya ste /
analyzed: lhag ma'i sa ni sa gnyis yan chad sa bcu man chad la bya ste /
translated: The remaining stages are the second stage and so on, up to the tenth stage.

original: sa de dgu ni bsgom pa'i lam zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa de dgu ni bsgom pa'i lam zhes bya'o //
translated: Those nine stages are called the path of cultivation.

original: bsgom pa'i lam de dag na /🔽byang chub sems dpa' des bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang ; shes bya'i sgrib pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam de dag na / byang chub sems dpa' des bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang ; shes bya'i sgrib pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: On those paths of cultivation,

original: bsgom pa la rab tu 'jug ste /
analyzed: bsgom pa la rab tu 'jug ste /
translated: that bodhisattva cultivates in order to abandon the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to the knowable that are to be abandoned by cultivation.

original: de'i tshe ci la bsgom zhe na /
analyzed: de'i tshe ci la bsgom zhe na /
translated: At that time, what is cultivated?

original: de nas 'byung ba'i ye shes gnyis la bsgom mo //
analyzed: de nas 'byung ba'i ye shes gnyis la bsgom mo //
translated: After that, cultivation is in the two kinds of knowledge.

original: ye shes gnyis po gang zhe na //🔽de'i phyir / ye shes de ni rnam mi rtog / sangs rgyas chos ni sbyong ba'o //
analyzed: ye shes gnyis po gang zhe na // de'i phyir / ye shes de ni rnam mi rtog / sangs rgyas chos ni sbyong ba'o //
translated: What are the two kinds of knowledge?🔽Therefore, it is said:🔽That knowledge is nonconceptual,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and purifies the qualities of a buddha.

original: ye shes gcig pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: ye shes gcig pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes te /
translated: The single knowledge is nonconceptual knowledge.

original: ye shes des thams cad nam mkha'i rang bzhin du khong du chud pas bdag gi rgyud la stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams sbyong bar byed pas bdag yongs su smin par byed pa'o //🔽gzhan ni ji ltar rnam bzhag pas //🔽sems can rnam par smin byed pa //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ye shes des thams cad nam mkha'i rang bzhin du khong du chud pas bdag gi rgyud la stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams sbyong bar byed pas bdag yongs su smin par byed pa'o // gzhan ni ji ltar rnam bzhag pas // sems can rnam par smin byed pa // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Since that intuition comprehends all things as having the nature of space, it purifies the Buddha qualities of the powers, fearlessnesses, etc. in one's own life-stream, and thus it ripens oneself.

original: gzhan ni zhes bya ba la ye shes gnyis pa ni zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan ni zhes bya ba la ye shes gnyis pa ni zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The second intuition is the intuition of the knowledge of presentation,🔽by which one presents the individual characteristics and qualities of the ten stages, etc.

original: ye shes gnyis pa ni ji ltar rnam par 'jog pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: ye shes gnyis pa ni ji ltar rnam par 'jog pa'i ye shes te /
translated: The second intuition is the intuition of the knowledge of presentation.

original: ye shes des sa bcu so so'i mtshan nyid dang yon tan la sogs pa so sor ma 'dres pa kho nar so sor 'jog bye brag 'byed pa'o//🔽de'ang gang zhe na /
analyzed: ye shes des sa bcu so so'i mtshan nyid dang yon tan la sogs pa so sor ma 'dres pa kho nar so sor 'jog bye brag 'byed pa'o// de'ang gang zhe na /
translated: By that intuition one presents the individual characteristics and qualities of the ten stages, etc.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rjes las thob pa dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rjes las thob pa dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes te /
translated: That is to say, it is the pure mundane intuition attained subsequent to the supramundane nonconceptual intuition.

original: des ni sems can la chos bstan pa dang / mngon par 'tshang rgya ba la sogs pa bstan pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: des ni sems can la chos bstan pa dang / mngon par 'tshang rgya ba la sogs pa bstan pa'i sgo nas /
translated: This verse shows how the bodhisattva teaches the Dharma to sentient beings and how he manifests full enlightenment and so forth.

original: sems can rnam par smin par byed do //
analyzed: sems can rnam par smin par byed do //
translated: This verse shows how the bodhisattva perfects sentient beings by teaching them the Dharma and by manifesting his own enlightenment.

original: bsgom pa yi ni mthar thug pa//
analyzed: bsgom pa yi ni mthar thug pa//
translated: The culmination of meditation

original: @280a * // grangs med gnyis kyis rdzogs par 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba la /

translated: He has attained the concentration of extensive dispassion, which means he has attained the concentration of serenity and insight of the Great Vehicle.

original: der yang ma zad kyis de dag la gnas pa'i tshe theg pa chen po'i gtams pa dang gdams pa yang 'thob ste /
analyzed: der yang ma zad kyis de dag la gnas pa'i tshe theg pa chen po'i gtams pa dang gdams pa yang 'thob ste /
translated: Not only that, but when they abide in those, they also obtain the instructions and further instructions of the Great Vehicle.

original: des ni ye shes kyi tshogs rdzogs par bstan to //
analyzed: des ni ye shes kyi tshogs rdzogs par bstan to //
translated: This teaches the perfection of the accumulation of wisdom.

original: de ltar bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs rdzogs pa'i sems dpa'i mchog byang chub sems dpa' des sangs kyi sar yon tan rgya mtsho'i pha rol du 'gro ste /
analyzed: de ltar bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs rdzogs pa'i sems dpa'i mchog byang chub sems dpa' des sangs kyi sar yon tan rgya mtsho'i pha rol du 'gro ste /
translated: Thus, the supreme bodhisattvas, who have completed the accumulations of merit and wisdom, go beyond the ocean of qualities to the buddha ground.

original: don du na stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa 'tshang rgya ba 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don du na stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa 'tshang rgya ba 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In fact, they attain enlightenment, which is endowed with the qualities of the powers, fearlessnesses, and so forth.

original: bsdu ba ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bsdu ba ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: This is the summary.

original: gang la bslab pa dang / ji ltar bslab pa dang / gang gis bslab pa gsum las /
analyzed: gang la bslab pa dang / ji ltar bslab pa dang / gang gis bslab pa gsum las /
translated: Among the three topics—what is to be trained in, how to train, and who trains—

original: ji ltar bslab pa'i don bsdus na 'di rnams ston to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ji ltar bslab pa'i don bsdus na 'di rnams ston to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the meaning of the summary is that this teaches the meaning of how to train.

original: mos pa dang ni mang po dang // chos tshol ba dang bshad pa dang // de bzhin du ni sgrub pa dang // yang dag gdams shing rjes su bstan //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mos pa dang ni mang po dang // chos tshol ba dang bshad pa dang // de bzhin du ni sgrub pa dang // yang dag gdams shing rjes su bstan // zhes bya ba la /
translated: and correct instruction and teaching.🔽From this point onward, in the section on how to train, the text explains the following:

original: ji ltar bslab par bya ba'i skabs las 'di yan chad du mos pa mang ba dang / chos tshol ba dang / chos bshad pa dang / de bzhin du bsgrub pa dang / yang dag par gtams shing rjes su bstan pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar bslab par bya ba'i skabs las 'di yan chad du mos pa mang ba dang / chos tshol ba dang / chos bshad pa dang / de bzhin du bsgrub pa dang / yang dag par gtams shing rjes su bstan pa ste /
translated: interest, vast resources, seeking the Dharma, teaching the Dharma, similarly, practice, and correct instruction and teaching.

original: de rnams bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de rnams bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: gdams shing rjes su bstan pa'i skabs bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: gdams shing rjes su bstan pa'i skabs bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: This completes the explanation of the section on instruction and teaching.
